title: blizzard
body:
A blizzard is a severe [[winter]] snowstorm characterized by strong winds and low visibility. It should not look pleasant. Roughly 45 degree or greater for incoming snow and/or strong visible winds blowing already fallen snow (ground blizzard).

Not to be confused with [[blizzard_entertainment]]


* !post #8067068

title: faceless_male
body:
When a male's facial features (mainly the eyes) don't appear, either because they're hidden, covered by hair, in shadow, or not drawn at all.

This tag does not apply when the character's [[head out of frame|head is completely out of frame]]. For instance, this tag doesn't apply to [[pov]] images that display only the viewer's own body.

h4. See also

* [[faceless female]]
* [[out of frame]]

title: natasha_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

Fastidious and kind, she is one of the few [[doctor]]s from The Underworld where medical resources are scarce. Voiced by [[Uchiyama Yumi]] in Japanese.

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] tied to a [[low ponytail]], [[red eyes]], [[large breasts]], and a [[mole under mouth|mole underneath her mouth]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black leotard]] with a [[vial]], [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves|elbow glove]] on her right, [[white jacket]], [[black pantyhose]], [[brown belt]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. 

h4. Costumes

* !post #7689985

h4. Profile
[expand]
A fastidious doctor who always wears a curious smile.

In the Underworld where medical resources are few and far between, Natasha is one of the very few doctors whom the people can turn to.

Even the rambunctious [[Hook (honkai: star rail)|]] would politely greet her... "Hi, Auntie Natasha."
[/expand]

h4. See also

* [[Raven (Honkai Impact)|Natasha Cioara]] - her [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] counterpart.

title: humanity_(dark_souls)
body:
[b]Humanity[/b] is a recurring element throughout the [i][[Dark Souls (series)|]][/i] trilogy. [spoilers]It is eventually revealed to be fragments of the titular Dark Soul.[/spoilers]

The tag mainly refers to the humanities used as an item in [i][[Dark Souls I]][/i], or the humanity phantoms seen in that game's [i]Artorias of the Abyss[/i] DLC.

body: A term used to denote great lust from a female, exclusively girls with animal features such as [[animal ears]] or [[furry|anthropomorphic animals]]. Signs include [[blush|blushing]], [[sweat]], and [[heavy breathing]].

title: goddess_(nikke)
body:
A squad from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

The ill-fated yet legendary titular squad from the first Rapture invasion led by the [[The Legendary Commander (Nikke)|Legendary Commander]] and consisting of the late [[Liliweiss (nikke)|]] (also known as Lilith), [[Dorothy (nikke)|]], [[Red Hood (nikke)|]], [[Snow White (innocent days) (nikke)|Snow White]], [[Scarlet (black shadow) (nikke)|Scarlet]], and [[Rapunzel (pure grace) (nikke)|Rapunzel]].

[spoiler]The squad's downfall came during Operation Ark Guardian when the Central Government decided to leave the squad to die on the surface after the squad successfully secured the safety of humanity. This also marks Dorothy's descent into madness. With Liliweiss dead and Red Hood missing, the remaining three members of the Goddess squad would form [[Pioneer (nikke)|]].[/spoiler]

title: scary_monsters_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Diego Brando]] and [[Doctor Ferdinand]] from [[Steel Ball Run]]. When used by Dr. Ferdinand, he can transform others into dinosaurs and control them. Diego was one of his first victims and would later have a variation of the Stand thanks to one of the Corpse Parts, allowing him to transform into a human/dinosaur hybrid with greatly increased physical abilities. He can also use his power to morph animals into minion dinosaurs.

The namesake is [i]Scary Monsters (and Super Creeps)[/i], the 14th studio album by [[David Bowie]], released on 12 September 1980, as well as a song of the same name on said album.
other_names: スケアリー・モンスターズ

title: beastars
body:
[b]Beastars[/b] (stylized as [b]BEASTARS[/b]) is a manga and anime series written by [[Itagaki Paru]], daughter of [[Itagaki Keisuke]] of [[Grappler Baki]] fame. It was serialized in Weekly Shonen Champion from 2016 to 2020. An anime adaptation was released in 2019.

Set in a civilized modern world of [[furry|anthropomorpic animals]] where cultural divides exists among the carnivores and herbivores, and where eating meat (which always come from other anthropomorphic animal) is considered illegal. the series follows [[Legoshi]], an anthropomorpic [[grey wolf]] college student who is caught between a wave of distrust after the killing and devoring of one of the herbivore student in his college.

title: glasgow_smile
body:
A facial [[injury|wound]] where the victim's mouth is slit from the corners, giving the impression of a wide, yet forced smile.

Also known as "Chelsea smile".

h4. Notable examples

* [[Kuchisake-onna]], ("Slit-Mouthed Woman") The tale of a woman, mutilated by a jealous husband, and returned as a malevolent spirit. Her defining characteristic is her mouth, which extends from ear to ear in a horrible, permanent smile.
* [[Kakihara Masao]] from [i][[Koroshiya Ichi]][/i];
* [[Joker (dc)|]] from Christopher Nolan's [i][[The Dark Knight]][/i].

title: palestinian_flag
body:
The [[palestine|Palestinian]] flag is a triband of black, white, and green from top to bottom, overlaid by a red triangle issuing from the hoist. This flag is derived from the Pan-Arab colors and it was first adopted on 28 May 1964 by the Palestine Liberation Organization. The flag day is celebrated on 30 September.

The flag is almost identical to that of the extinct Hashemite Kingdom of Hejaz and to that of the "Ba'ath Party":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_the_Ba%27ath_Party].

title: red_wolf_of_radagon
body:
[[Red Wolf of Radagon]] is a boss in [[Elden Ring]]. This boss is found in the Debate Hall of Raya Lucaria. As the name might suggest, it has red-orange jagged fur. Like the other Red Wolves, it's extremely agile and has several magic abilities.

[spoiler][[Rennala Queen of the Full Moon]] won it in her divorce with [[Radagon of the Golden Order]].[/spoiler]

title: ibis-series_cel-240
body: IB-01: CEL 240 A boss [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. A Coral-powered C-weapon developed by the Rubicon Research Institute. This metalic silver coloured autonomous craft is both humanoid and bird-like in appearance with two sets of double flared shoulder armours and [[reverse-jointed legs]], utilises its high mobility and remote controlled weaponry in combat. CEL 240 attacks with Coral based weaponry both melee and ranged, houses 12 Coral Orbit remote weapons in its extended flared shoulder armor in a similar manner to how the [[qubeley|AMX-004 Qubeley]]/[[kshatriya|NZ-666 Kshatriya]] uses 'Funnels' from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]. It is said CEL 240's appearance and combat style is a direct reference to the Qubeley, and its ability to resurrect after first defeat together with its extravagant attack move sets is also a reference to [[malenia goddess of rot|Malenia]] from [[Elden Ring]], another FromSoftware title.

title: g4_volta
body:
A NPC in the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. An augmented human and AC pilot associated with the Balam corporation group, a member of their in-house AC mercenary group 'Redguns', assigned the title G4 (Pronounced 'Gun 4') Volta, referred to the Volta river in Ghana. He pilots the AC 'Cannon Head'.

There is no canon depiction of Volta in game, artists depictions may draw inspirations from the ethnicity of people around the river Volta used as his callsign, and/or from the AC he pilots.

Voiced by: Egashira Hiroya (JP)

title: ha-t-102_juggernaut
body: HA-T-102 JUGGERNAUT A heavy mobile artillery platform used by the Rubicon Liberation Front in the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. Fitted with a wide array of frontal firing [[cannon|cannons]], [[autocannon|autocannons]] and [[gatling gun|gatling cannons]] of various calibre, heavily armed and armored from the front, relies on a large tank-like chassis with a pair of [[caterpillar tracks]] and large back mounted [[thrusters]] for mobility.

title: g6_red
body:
A NPC in the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. An augmented human and AC pilot associated with the Balam corporation group, a member of their in-house AC mercenary group 'Redguns', assigned the title G6 (Pronounced 'Gun 6') Red, referred to the Red River of the South in Texas, North America. He pilots the AC 'Hermit'.

There is no canon depiction of Red in game, artists depictions may draw inspirations from the locals from the region used as his callsign, and/or from the AC he pilots.

Voiced by: Robby Daymond (EN), Okai Katsunori (JP)

title: arqueboy
body: A fan made [[mascot]]/[[personification]] of the fictional company Arquebus Corporation from the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. A portmanteau of 'Arquebus' and 'Boy'. It is a humanoid figure that wears the arch section of the letter A over its head like a colonial powdered wig. Usually depicted [[fighting|fist-fighting]] against [[Baltaro]], the Balam corporation counter part.

title: g2_nile
body:
A NPC in the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. An augmented human and AC pilot associated with the Balam corporation group, a member of their in-house AC mercenary group 'Redguns', assigned the title G2 (Pronounced 'Gun 2') Nile, referred to the river Nile in northeastern Africa. He pilots the AC 'Deep Down'.

There is no canon depiction of Nile in game, artists depictions may draw inspirations from the region around the river Nile and/or from the AC he pilots.

Voiced by: Komatsu Fuminori (JP)

title: g3_wu_huahai
body:
A NPC in the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. An augmented human and AC pilot associated with the Balam corporation group, a member of their in-house AC mercenary group 'Redguns', assigned the title G3 (Pronounced 'Gun 3') Wu Huahai, referred to the Five Flower Lake (五花海) in the Jiuzhaigou natural reserve. He pilots the AC 'Li Long'.

There is no canon depiction of Wu Huahai in game, but his Chinese callsign likely influenced the [[Asian]] ethnicity in depictions.

Voiced by: Johnny Yong Bosch (EN), Gotou Hiroki (JP)

title: dafeng_nyan-nyan
body:
A fan made character who represents ([[personification|personifies]]), plays the role of a [[mascot]], or a [[booth babe]] for the fictional company 'Dafeng' from the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. The name Dafeng Nyan-nyan derives from the company name 大丰 'Dafeng' and 娘娘 'Nyan-nyan' (pinyin: Niang-niang), the latter means 'Lady' or 'Highness' in Chinese, as Dafeng is a Chinese themed company. The design of the character is based on the in-game company's design philosophy: "Stout tree, Slender branches", which is interpreted by artists as [[large breasts|large]]/[[huge breasts]] [[thick thighs]], with slender limbs.

The two Hanzi character used for the company name Dafeng can be literally translated/interpreted as big and bountiful, which may have also played a role in defining the character design of Dafeng Nyan-nyan.

title: baltaro
body: A fan made [[mascot]]/[[personification]] of the fictional company Balam Corporation Group from the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. A portmanteau of 'Balam' and 'Taro'(太郎), a Japanese male name. It is the Balam's logo in a hexagonal prism form, with humanoid arms and legs. Usually depicted [[fighting|fist-fighting]] against [[Arqueboy]], the Arquebus Corporation counter part.

title: chatty_stick
body:
A NPC in the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. A suggestion-based AI and the personal assistance of [[cinder carla|"Cinder" Carla]]. He pilots the AC 'Circus'.

There is no canon depiction of 'Chatty' in game, artists depictions may draw inspirations the AC 'Circus' itself as a reference.

Voiced by: Aoyama Yutaka (JP)
other_names: チャティ・スティック

title: g1_michigan
body:
A NPC in the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. An augmented human and AC pilot associated with the Balam corporation group, and the leader of their in-house AC mercenary group 'Redguns', assigned the title G1 (Pronounced 'Gun 1') Michigan, referenced the Great Lake Michigan. He is given the nickname 'Hell on four legs', as he pilots the quadrupedal AC 'Liger Tail'.

There is no canon depiction of Michigan in game, but he is often depicted as a military battle hardened veteran/drill sergeant, likely influenced by his in-game dialogues and the way he behaves.

Voiced by: D.C. Douglas (EN), Satou Setsuji (JP)

title: murakumo_mdl.1
body:
BD-0 MURAKUMO (the name in [[Armored Core V]]/ACV)
MURAKUMO mdl.1 (the name in [[Armored Core: Verdict Day]]/ACVD)

The single mainstay melee weapon of From Software's [[Armored Core]] franchise post Armored Core 5 and remaining until its sequel, Armored Core Verdict Day.  The weapon consists of a backwards folded knife blade stowed in an arm unit, flipped out with a swing of the forearm.

title: murakumo
body:
Ambiguous tag. Originally means "gathering clouds" in Japanese.

title: zodiac
body:
The [b]zodiac[/b] is the "band" of the night sky roughly corresponding to the solar system's ecliptic plane. Western astrologers divide it into twelve signs, named for the constellation that is nearest the position of the Sun for one-twelfth of the year.  (These periods do not quite line up with the calendar months, so that the sign of the zodiac changes around the twentieth or twenty-first of the month.)

Not to be confused with the popular brand of semi-rigid inflatable boats, the serial killer, the former-Soviet rock band, or the town of Zodiac, Missouri.

h4. The Twelve Signs of the Zodiac

Note: Please don't make these tags into character tags, as they do not refer to specific characters.

* ♈ [[Aries (zodiac)|]]: The Ram, "The Agrarian Worker".
* ♉ [[Taurus (zodiac)|]]: The Bull, "The Steer of Heaven".
* ♊ [[Gemini (zodiac)|]]: The Twins, "The Great Twins".
* ♋ [[Cancer (zodiac)|]]: The Crab, "The Crayfish".
* ♌ [[Leo (zodiac)|]]: The Lio, "The Lion".
* ♍ [[Virgo (zodiac)|]]: The Maiden, "The Furrow"; "The Furrow, the goddess Shala's ear of corn".
* ♎ [[Libra (zodiac)|]]: The Scales, "The Scales".
* ♏ [[Scorpio (zodiac)|]]: The Scorpion, "The Scorpion".
* ♐ [[Sagittarius (zodiac)|]]: Centaur The Archer, "soldier".
* ♑ [[Capricorn (zodiac)|]]: "Goat-horned", "The Goat-Fish".
* ♒ [[Aquarius (zodiac)|]]: The Water Bearer, "The Great One", later "pitcher".
* ♓ [[Pisces (zodiac)|]]: The Fish, "The Tail of the Swallow", later "fish-cord".

h4.Other beings called Zodiac

* [[zodiac_(sekaiju)|Zodiac]] ([[Sekaiju no Meikyuu 3]])
* [[Zodiac Libra]] & [[Zodiac Virgo]] & (［[[zodiac_ophiuchus|spoilers mecha]]］) ([[Reflex]] / [[The Tale of Alltynex]])
* AMA-100 [[Z'od-iacok]] ([[Gundam Sentinel]])
* [[zodiac_(alphonse_mucha)|Zodiac]] ([[art nouveau|Alphonse Mucha]])
* Combat Unit "Zodiac":[/tags?commit=Search&search%5bcategory%5d=4&search%5bhide_empty%5d=yes&search%5bname_matches%5d=Zodiac_No._*&search%5border%5d=count&utf8=✓] ([[Armored Core V]])
* "Zodiarts":[/tags?commit=Search&search%5bcategory%5d=4&search%5bhide_empty%5d=yes&search%5bname_matches%5d=*_zodiarts&search%5border%5d=count&utf8=✓] & [[zodiarts switch]] ([[kamen_rider_fourze_(series)|Kamen Rider Fourze]])

title: manus_father_of_the_abyss
body:
[b]Manus, Father of the Abyss[/b] is the final boss and main antagonist of [i][[Dark Souls I]][/i]'s DLC expansion [i]Artorias of the Abyss[/i], and an overarching antagonist of [[dark souls (series)|the trilogy]] as a whole.

He is an [[eldritch abomination|eldritch]], ape-like [[monster]] ([spoilers]originally an ordinary human before losing control of his dark soul[/spoilers]) with [[extra eyes|extra]] [[red eyes]] on his body and an [[oversized limbs|oversized]] left arm.

title: safy_(fire_emblem)
body:
A playable character in [[Fire Emblem: Thracia 776]], who was sent by her mistress, [[Linoan (Fire Emblem)|]], to search for help in fighting back against the Granvalle Empire. During her travels, she is abducted by [[Lifis (Fire Emblem)|]] and his pirate gang, until she is rescued by [[Leif (Fire Emblem)|]] and his army. Additionally, Safy has [[Tina (Fire Emblem)|]] for a younger sister.

She has [[long hair|long]], [[green hair]], covered by a white hood with a [[white cape]], and wears a green and yellow [[dress]]

title: ronan_(fire_emblem)
body: A playable character from [[Fire Emblem: Thracia 776]], who is a villager from Iz who joins [[Leif (Fire Emblem)|]]'s army to fight back against [[Lifis (Fire Emblem)|]]' pirates, who have terrorized the village for years. He is notable in-game for having an unusually high magic growth, despite being an archer.

title: nashandra
body:
[i][[Dark Souls II]][/i] character. She is both the final boss of the base game and the main antagonist[spoilers], being a fragment of [[Manus Father of the Abyss]] who sought to take over Drangleic[/spoilers].

She is a [[giantess|giant woman]] with [[blonde hair]], wearing a [[white dress]] with a [[gold trim]].
[spoilers]Her true form is a black [[Grim Reaper]]-esque monster with [[black hair|black]] [[tentacle hair]] and a dress made of skeletons and black goo.

title: emerald_herald
body:
[i][[Dark Souls II]][/i] character. She has [[brown|auburn]] [[short hair]], wears a [[green dress]] and a [[hooded cloak]]. She normally has [[heterochromia]], which isn't visible, because she always wears her [[hair over one eye]].

She plays a major part in the game, because she levels the player up, just like the [[Maiden in Black]] from [i][[Demon's Souls]][/i].

Before the path to the final boss [spoiler]she removes her hood and tells the player her actual name is Shanalotte.[/spoiler]

title: hip_dips
body:
Hip dips are when the line from the waist to the thighs are not a smooth curved line.

It can be subtle as a slope, or as prominent as a box or violin, which is where the terms "box hips" and "violin hips" came from.

Do not tag a image or video if the character has smooth curved hips.

h4. Examples

* !post #7847683
* !post #6613373

h4. See also

* [[hip focus]]
* [[narrow waist]]
* [[wide hips]]

title: long_legs
body:
Noticeably longer [[legs]] than average.

As a rule of thumb, if a character's legs are longer than their upper body, it's fine to use this tag.

Keep in mind that [[high heels]] create the illusion of longer legs, so always discount the character's footwear when deciding whether to use this tag.

title: legs
body:
When legs are the main focus of the image. If the legs in question are not on full display, [i]not just [[thighs]][/i], please refrain from using this tag.

h4. See also

* [[Bare legs]]
* [[Crossed legs]]
* [[Leg up]]
* [[Legs up]]
* [[Hugging own legs]]
* [[Long legs]]
* [[Tag Group:Body Parts]]
* [[Tag Group:Posture]]

title: thick_thighs
body:
[[Thighs]] that are thicker than "normal."

Don't add this tag just because thighs are visible. The actual size must be large to use this tag. In general, be careful if you have a character with either a very [[fat]] waist that doesn't require the thighs to be very thick, or a very [[skinny|thin]] waist that requires the thighs to be very thick, if each thigh is about the same size as the character's waist.

h4. Examples

* !post #1557661
* !post #7300429
* !post #5479568

* [[wide hips]]
* [[curvy]]
* [[thighs]]

Different from [[ribs (food)]], which refers to ribs from an animal cooked for consumption.

title: alstroemeria_(flower)
body:
[b][i]Alstroemeria[/i][/b], also known as Peruvian lily or lily of the Incas, is a genus of ornamental [[flower]]ing plants in the [i]Alstroemeriaceae[/i] family, native to South America.

Alstroemeria flowers are visually similar to [[lily (flower)|lilies]], but have striking differences. They have six petals, three outer petals and three inner petals, two of which point upward; there are also six curved stamens. The inner petals are narrower and almost always spotted or streaked; in some species, only the two upward-pointing petals are spotted or streaked. Alstroemeria flowers come in a wide variety of colors, including red, orange, yellow, shades of green, purple, pink, and white.

Despite the common name Lily of the Incas and some visual similarity, they are not [[lily (flower)|true lilies]] and should not be tagged as such.

h4. Examples
* !asset #23830433: Inflorescence
* !asset #23830493: Flower
* !post #865040
* !post #6700088

h4. See also
* [[Amaryllis (flower)|]]
* [[Hemerocallis]]
* [[Lily (flower)|]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Alstroemeria":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alstroemeria
* "Wikipedia: Alstroemeriaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alstroemeriaceae

title: medea_(dq8)
body:
The princess of Trodain who was turned into a horse by [[Dhoulmagus]]' curse. Medea can temporarily turn human thanks to a mystical spring.

Most art of her is her as a human, so for depictions of her as a horse, also tag [[Medea (Horse) (DQ8)]] + [[alternate form]].

title: second_sino-japanese_war
body:
The [b]Second Sino-Japanese war[/b], referred within [[China]] and [[Taiwan]] as "War of Resistance" and in [[Japan]] as "China-Japan war", was a [[war]] between the [[Kuomintang]]-led Republic of [[China]] with [[Communism|Communist]] China assistance and the Empire of [[Japan]]. The war began on 7 July 1937 when Japan invaded Manchuria,   and was arguably the start of [[World War II]]. The war, and World War II, ended with the Japanese surrender at the end of World War II on 2 September 1945.

The war is a result of an escalation of Imperial Japan's ambitions in the east Asia according to the so-called "Greater East Asian Co-Prosperity Sphere" policy. While the war caused various warlord factions participated in the [[Chinese Civil War]] to temporarily unite in effort to defend the country, the ill-equipped Chinese forces suffered massive losses due to their dated equipment, though not without stalling the Japanese advance and inflicting large amount of casualties as well. In total, between 15 to 21 millions people died during the war, making it the second deadliest war in the 20th century. 

The war is also infamous for numerous atrocities committed by the [[Imperial Japanese Army]], in particular after the battle of Nanjing. The atrocity ranges from mass [[rape]], indiscriminate mass killing, forced labor, usage of conventional and chemical weapons against civilians, and much more. Due to the modern Japanese government upheld the policy of "don't deny, don't admit" to not comment anything about the war, it still remains contentious issue between China and Japan (and Taiwan to an extent) to this day.

In Manchuria, Japan set up a puppet state called [[Manchukuo]], while in Inner Mongolia their puppet state in the [[Mongol United Autonomous Government]] had established a new government in the form of Mengjiang (also known as Mengkukuo in the West).

h4. See also

* [[Chinese Civil War]]

title: otto_mann
body: One of the many characters of the [[united_states|American]] animated comedy sitcom [[The Simpsons]], he is a former school underachiever who now drives the school bus for Springfield Elementary. Otto was initially conceived by Shearer himself as a caricature of heavy metal music aficionados who mostly play guitar and use drugs while occupying a low-level labor job. He then became a character well known for his party tendencies and calling others slang such as "dude", "lady", or "pops". He is friends with [[bart simpson|Bart]] despite their age difference, and dreams of starting his own rock band to become a celebrity, all while getting the school bus into trouble one time after another.

title: marian_e._carl
body:
Character from [[Noble Witches]]

Flight Lieutenant from Liberion serving in the [[506th Joint Fighter Wing]]. Friends with [[Takei Junko]], their mock battles would lead to the creation of the [[508th Joint Fighter Wing]].

Her weapons are M1919A6 and M2 heavy machine guns. Her familiar is an American quarter horse, and she's based on Marion Eugene Carl.

title: quackity_smp
body:
A roleplay-based multilingual [[Minecraft YouTube|Minecraft]] server founded by [[Quackity]]. Has members who stream primarily in English, Spanish, Brazilian Portuguese, French, Korean, and German.

Takes place on Quesadilla Island, a mysterious island the players wake up on that seems to be controlled by an unknown force known as the Federation. The island's host is [[Cucurucho]], a strange white bear creature with a tendency towards violence.

For a list of characters, see [[List of Minecraft YouTubers]].

* [[Purgatory (Quackity SMP)]]

title: patrick_pewterschmidt
body: Patrick Pewterschmidt is a character from [[Family Guy]], she is the [[lois griffin|Lois Griffin’s]] long lost older brother and son of Carter and Barbara Pewterschmidt. He was locked away in the Brookfield Insane Asylum by his parents, after he walked in on his mother performing oral sex on Jackie Gleason. He had a nervous breakdown and was sent to Brookfield, where he came to the conclusion that Gleason was evil because he was fat, leading him to hate fat people.

title: joe_swanson
body:
Joseph "Joe" Swanson is a macho paraplegic [[police]] officer in the Quahog Police Department who is at many times subject to intense anger problems. He is married to [[Bonnie Swanson]] and has two children; Susie and Kevin.

He is the fourth member of the group of buddies along with Peter, Quagmire, and Cleveland who live on Spooner Street in [[Family Guy]]. He was voiced by Patrick Warburton.

title: bonnie_swanson
body: Bonnie Swanson is a character from [[Family Guy]], she is the wife of Griffin neighbor [[Joe Swanson]], and mother of Kevin and Susie Swanson. Bonnie was originally pregnant for the first 116 episodes until giving birth to daughter Susie Swanson in "Ocean's Three and a Half", and quickly lost the baby weight. She has curly black hair, which was auburn in her first appearance in "A Hero Sits Next Door" and the color briefly returns in a scene goof in "A Very Special Family Guy Freakin' Christmas".

title: cassandra_nova
body:
Cassandra Nova Xavier is a supervillain appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]], most commonly in association with the [[X-Men]]. Created by writer Grant Morrison and artist Frank Quitely, the character first appeared in New X-Men #114 (July 2001). She is a mummudrai, a parasitic life form born bodiless on the astral plane.
Cassandra is the twin sister of X-Men founder, the telepath Professor X ([[Charles Xavier]]). While in the womb together, Charles recognized her evil presence and killed her, resulting in her stillbirth.
The character made her live-action debut in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU) film [[Deadpool & Wolverine]] (2024), portrayed by Emma Corrin.

title: ambience_synesthesia
body:
[b]Ambience Synesthesia[/b] is an annual real-world live concert featuring music from [[Arknights]], hosted by Hypergryph in China. The first concert was held in May 2021, the second took place in October 2022,  the third between April-May 2023 and the fourth in May 2024.

As part of the concert's promotion, some of the Arknights characters were drawn with new costumes.

The Ambience Synesthesia tag is to be used when an Arknights character is wearing costumes from the concert.

title: lamborghini
body:
Italian automobile manufacturer, known for high-performance [[motor vehicle|motor vehicles]]. Almost all of their [[sport car]]s are powered by 12-cylinder engines, as is often tradition for high-end Italian automakers. They also have a lesser known division producing agricultural [[tractor]]s, which are the company's original main line of products.

Lamborghini's main rivals include [[Ferrari]] and [[Porsche]].

h4. Tagged models

[b]Standard-production cars[/b]
* [[Lamborghini Miura]], the first Lamborghini sports car, introduced in 1966.
* [[Lamborghini Espada]], a 4-seater grand touring coupe sold alongside the Miura.
* [[Lamborghini Countach]], the second model produced by the marque. Produced in the 1980s.
* [[Lamborghini Murciélago]], the flagship model from 2002 to 2010.
* [[Lamborghini Aventador]], the flagship model from 2011 to 2021.
** [[Lamborghini Aventador J]]
** [[Lamborghini Aventador S]]
** [[Lamborghini Aventador SV]]
** [[Lamborghini Aventador SVJ]]
* [[Lamborghini Gallardo]], the 'baby brother' to the Murciélago. Known for its 10-cylinder engine.
* [[Lamborghini Huracan]], the baby brother to the Aventador. Succeeded the Gallardo.
** [[Lamborghini Huracan Sterrato]], an off-road variant of the Lamborghini Huracán.
** [[Lamborghini Huracan Tecnica]], an updated version of the Huracán, using the Huracán STO's engine.
* [[Lamborghini Urus]], an [[sports utility vehicle|SUV]] introduced in 2018.
* [[Lamborghini Revuelto]], the flagship model from 2023. The first plug-in hybrid of the marque.
* [[Lamborghini Temerario]], the baby brother to the Revuelto. Succeeded the  Huracán. Uses a V8 mid-engine instead of a V10.

[b]Limited-production cars[/b]
* [[Lamborghini Reventon]], a limited model segueing between the Murciélago and Aventador.
* [[Lamborghini Veneno]], a limited model based on the Aventador, released for the marque's 50th anniversary.
* [[Lamborghini Centenario]], a limited model based on the Aventador, released for founder Ferruccio Lamborghini's 100th birthday.
* [[Lamborghini Sian]], the first hybrid by the marque. Limited to 63 coupes and 19 roadsters.
* [[Lamborghini Countach LPI 800-4]], the second hybrid by the marque. It is a homage to the original Lamborghini Countach to mark the 50th year anniversary of its introduction. Limited to 112 units.

[b]Concept Cars[/b]
* [[Lamborghini Egoista]], a single-seater designed for the marque's 50th anniversary.

[b]Tractors[/b]
* [[Lamborghini Lamborghinetta]]
* [[Lamborghini R8]]

[b]Other[/b]
* [[Lamborghini LM002]] a jeep-like off-road supercar marketed for military uses.

title: trapezium
body: Trapezium (トラペジウム, Torapejiumu) is a Japanese novel written by then-Nogizaka46 member Kazumi Takayama. It was initially serialized in Kadokawa Shoten's Da Vinci book and manga news magazine from April 2016 to August 2018. Kadokawa Shoten later published the novel in print with cover art by Tae in November 2018. An anime film adaptation produced by CloverWorks premiered in Japan in May 2024. A manga adaptation illustrated by Kina Kazuharu will begin serialization on Kadokawa Shoten's KadoComi website in Q4 2024.

title: apostle_atlanta
body:
A character from the [[Toushin Toshi]] series, who also makes appearances in the [[Rance (series)|Rance series]].

A witch of mysterious origin, Atlanta is an Apostle of Dark Lord [[Lexington]], alongside [[Apostle Juno|Juno]], carrying her master's Demonic Blood Soul in search of a worthy heir. A mischievious person, she enjoys trapping people, mostly girls, in mirrors and dividing them into fragments scattered across an area.

She possesses [[long hair|long]], [[blue hair]], and has [[red eyes]] and [[pointy ears]] with [[grey skin]]. She is never seen wearing any clothing, and always apears [[completely nude]] as a result.

title: seaborn_(arknights)
body:
Non-human lifeforms born of the ocean, initiators of the Profound Silence. They have a very short evolutionary cycle to deal with hostile creatures and the environment. To this day, they continue to threaten Ægir and the coasts of Iberia.

The Seaborn are hyper-adaptive aquatic creatures hailing from the abyss of Terra's oceans. They evolve incredibly fast and possess the ability to mutate their own somatic cells without relying on generational heredity.

title: elden_beast
body:
The [b]Elden Beast[/b] is a creature in [[Elden Ring]]. An enormous, [[dragon]]-like creature with [[multiple wings]], seemingly formed from starlight and the void surrounding it. It [[holding sword|wields]] a [[sword]] capable of projecting waves of golden light.

It is [spoilers]the true form of the [[Elden Ring (object)|]], younger sibling to [[metyr mother of fingers|Metyr]], and final boss of the game.[/spoilers] There is a subtle [[crack]] on its belly that can blend in with the streams of light inside its body if one isn't paying attention, [spoilers]where [[queen marika the eternal|Marika]] struck the the Ring at the start of the Shattering.[/spoilers]

title: finger_reader_enia
body:

[spoiler]Enia will give the Tarnished a talisman pouch after defeating two remembrance bosses.[/spoiler]

title: toronto_transit_commission
body:
The Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) is the primary public transport agency in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, operating the majority of the city's bus and rail services. It is the oldest and largest of the urban transit service providers in the Greater Toronto Area, with numerous connections to systems serving its surrounding municipalities.

title: carol_pingrey
body:
[b]Carol Pingrey[/b] is a minor character in [[The Loud House]]. She is [[lori_loud|Lori Loud]]'s former rival, schoolmate, and best friend.

[b]Appearance[/b]

Carol has a striking resemblance to Lori, except she has longer [[blonde_hair|blonde hair]] that points to her right side; she wears a [[blue_hairband|blue]] [[hairband]], light blue [[eyeshadow]], a [[blue_shirt|blue]] [[shirt]] with a white collar, a brown skirt with a checker pattern, and [[brown_footwear|brown]] [[shoes]] with purplish-blue [[socks]] worn high as shown in "Picture Perfect". She gets a re-color in "Selfie Improvement", with her [[shirt]], [[socks]], [[eyeshadow]] (now similar to [[luna_loud|Luna]]'s), and headband now being purple.

title: women's_day
body:
International Women's Day, also known as Festa della Donna or Mimosa Day, is celebrated on the 8th of March every year, highlighting feminist movements and achievements as well as bringing attention to issues that affect women. Yellow [[mimosa (flower)|]] are used to represent the holiday, chosen by Italian politician Teresa Mattei in 1946.

title: periwinkle_(flower)
body:
[b][i]Vinca[/i][/b], commonly called periwinkle, is a genus of low-growing [[flower]]ing plants in the family [i]Apocynaceae[/i]. Two of the most commonly cultivated species are [i]Vinca major[/i] (greater periwinkle) and [i]Vinca minor[/i] (lesser periwinkle), which differ mainly in size. It is often used as an ornamental ground cover.

Periwinkle flowers are tubular, consisting of five distinctive pinwheel-like petals with blunt, broad tips; the center of the flower has a prominent star to pentagon shape. The color of the flowers usually varies between blue and purple; occasionally white. The leaves are elliptic (oval to lance-shaped).

h4. Examples
* !asset #23820874: [i]Vinca minor[/i]
* !asset #23820861: [i]Vinca minor[/i]
* !asset #23820768: [i]Vinca major[/i]

title: plumeria
body:
A genus of flowering plants in the family [i]Apocynaceae[/i]. Most species are deciduous shrubs or small trees that grow in tropical regions. One of the most commonly depicted species is [i]Plumeria rubra[/i], also known as [b]frangipani[/b].

Plumeria flowers are five-petaled with finely defined, overlapping petals. The petal tips are usually rounded. Flowers can be of various colors, but most are multicolored.

In anime art, it is frequently used in beach scenes as a [[hair ornament]] or part of a [[flower necklace]].

h4. Examples

title: sasha_banks
body:
American professional wrestler, previously worked for [[WWE]]. Currently working for [[All Elite Wrestling]], [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]] and [[World Wonder Ring Stardom]] as [b]Mercedes Moné[/b].

Real name: [b]Mercedes Kaestner-Varnado[/b]

h4. Known moves

* [i]Bank Statement[/i]/[I]Statement Maker[/I] (Bridging [[Crossface]], often transitioned from a Double Knee Backbreaker)
* Bankrupt (Straight jacket neckbreaker slam)
* [I]Moné Maker[/I] (Gory Special dropped into a [[DDT (wrestling)|]])

title: sakana~_(meme)
body:
[[Scene reference]] taken from episode 4 of [i][[Lycoris Recoil]][/i], wherein [[Inoue Takina]] sheepishly puts her [[hands together]] and thrusts them forward while simultaneously [[standing_on_one_leg|raising her right leg]] as if trying to a imitate a fish, wailing "Sakana~" ("It is a fish!") while doing so. Fanart imitating this pose (with either leg raised) by Takina, other characters in the show, and even characters from other copyrights have popped up since the episode aired.

This meme can sometimes extend to reference what happens next: [[Nishikigi Chisato]] joining Takina by standing near the latter and [[arms up|raising her arms]], pretending to be and shouting that she is a spotted [[garden eel]] ("Chianago~").

h4. Origin
* !asset #21314508

h4. External links

* "Youtube: Fish | Lycoris Recoil":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I5198X8XoY8]

title: crippler_crossface
body:
A neck crank in which the wrestler wrap both hands around the opponent's face and pull back, which applies pressure to the neck and shoulder area. 

This [[submission hold]] has multiple variants, as it is performed in several ways, usually from a prone position involving the wrestler trapping one of the opponent's arms:

-  The standard [b]Crippler Crossface[/b]: Also known as an [i]Arm-Trap Crossface[/i] or simply, the [i]Crossface[/i], it is a variation that involves an arm-trap by locking an opponent's arm in a leg scissors. This version is popularized by Chris Benoit. [[WWE]] Hall of Famer and current [[All Elite Wrestling]] wrestler [[Edge (wrestler)|Adam Copeland/Edge]] also uses this move as well as his own variant called the [i]Glasgow Grin[/i], where he uses a broken piece of a [[folding chair]] to gain more leverage in applying pressure to the opponent's neck. Copeland also uses the standard, legal version that he calls as the [I]Grindhouse[/I], which he sometimes combines with a [[sleeper hold]].

- [i]Omoplata Crossface[/i]: The wrestler takes an opponent’s arm and puts it in an [[omoplata]]. From there, the wrestler puts the opponent in a crossface, wrenching the neck and shoulder. Popularized by [[All Elite Wrestling]] wrestler [[Daniel Bryan|Bryan Danielson]] as the [i]LeBell Lock[/i] (also formerly known as the [i]YES! Lock[/i] or [i]NO! Lock[/i]). [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]] wrestler KENTA also uses this as the [i]Game Over[/i].

- [i]Chickenwing Over-the-Shoulder Crossface[/i]: The wrestler goes to a fallen opponent and places the opponent's nearest arm over the wrestler's nearest shoulder before applying the crossface, where the attacking wrestler locks their hands around the opponent's chin (or lower face), then pulls back, stretching the opponent's neck and shoulder. WWE wrestler Johnny Gargano uses this as his finisher named the [i]Gargano Escape[/i], which he adopted from his mentor, [[Total Nonstop Action Wrestling]] alumnus and fellow WWE wrestler [[Alex Shelley]], who calls this move as the [i]Border City Stretch[/i]. New Japan Pro Wrestling wrestler Ishimori Taiji also uses this move as the [i]Bone Lock[/i]. All Elite Wrestling wrestler Lee Moriarty also uses this move with Shelley's blessing just like Gargano (though unlike Gargano, who renamed the hold for his own use, Moriarty retained the Border City Stretch name).

- [i][[brutalizer|Scissored Armbar Crossface]][/i]: Innovated by [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]] wrestler Nagata Yuuji as the [I]Nagata Lock III[/I], it is also known as a [i]Double Underhook Crossface[/i] or a [i]Double Arm Crossface[/i]. It is a scissored armbar combined with a crossface, where the attacking wrestler traps one of the prone opponent's arms in his/her legs, wraps the opponent's other arm under the attacker's shoulder, and then applies the crossface. All Elite Wrestling wrestlers Pac and Dr. Britt Baker D.M.D. both use this variant, with the former calling his version the [i]Brutalizer[/i] and the latter's version the [i]Lockjaw[/i] which also has a mandible claw added to fit her dentist gimmick (which is also her real-life profession). Former professional wrestler [[Dave Bautista|Batista]] also used it as the [i]Batista Bite[/i]. WWE wrestler Tommaso Ciampa started using it again in 2023 as the [I]Sicilian Stretch[/I]. All Elite Wrestling wrestler Julia Hart has a sitting variation of this hold that she calls as the [I]Hartless[/I].

- [i]Bridging Crossface[/i]: A variant performed in a bridging position where the wrestler wraps both hands around the opponent's neck and pulls back, which applies pressure to the neck and bridges on the opponent's back for added leverage. However, it has no arm-trap involved unlike other crossface variants. This variation is used as a submission finisher by [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]] and [[World Wonder Ring Stardom]] wrestler Mercedes Mone (formerly known as [[Sasha Banks]] in WWE) as the [i]Bank Statement[/i] in WWE and [I]Statement Maker[/I] in AEW.
other_names: クリップラー・クロスフェイス

title: alex_shelley
body:

Real name: [b]Patrick Martin[/b]

title: elluka_chirclatia
body:
A character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] featured in [[Genzai Monogatari]]. Portrayed by [[Megurine Luka]], but generally shouldn't be tagged as such due to the different character designs.

A Leviant citizen and the fiance of [[Kiril Clockworker]]. She was a powerful witch and a major candidate in the 'MA' Project. After her death during the project, his fiance attempted to resurrect her using an ancient device, with disastrous consequences.

As an outcome of the resurrection, she became immortal and took the surname of his missing fiance, rechristening herself as [[Elluka Clockworker]].

She is one of the four singers of [[Ma Survival (vocaloid)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: エルルカ=チルクラシア

title: sanon_(umineko)
body: Sanon (玲音, Sanon) is one of the servants in [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]. [spoiler]From a meta perspective, she's the basis for [[Satan (Umineko)|]].[/spoiler]

title: satan_(umineko)
body:
One of [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]'s Seven [[Stakes of Purgatory]], and representative of the deadly sin of wrath. As short-tempered as her sin would imply, this third-eldest Stake can be differentiated by her curly, platinum blond hair.

[spoiler]The human she is based on is [[Sanon (Umineko)|]].[/spoiler]

Named after, of course, the Adversary of Abrahamic faiths.

title: goku_and_vegeta_in_the_rain_(meme)
body:
Posts referencing a drawing from April 2023 by [[koralldiz]] featuring [[Vegeta]] standing in the rain with a serious expression and [[son_goku|Goku]] in the background looking up with his mouth open and tongue out to collect rainwater.
A badly redrawn doodle posted in October 2024 by "@BFrog":[https://x.com/BFrog__/] went viral on Twitter which then drew attention to the original.

title: plump
body:
Slightly chubby, but not enough to be [[fat]]. A saying that goes around for plump is "Fat in all the right places".

The Japanese tags above are Pixiv's equivalent of the word, but be aware that not all Pixiv-centric uses of those tags fit Danbooru's definition. As with all other size-specific tags, observe the body and see if the tag actually needs to be used before adding it; make sure that the body is not simply “[[curvy]]” and that it’s not “[[fat]]”, either. 

Plump is mutually exclusive with [[fat]] and [[obese]].

h4. Examples
* !post #7846241
* !post #5020301
* !post #5212327
* !post #7589244

h4. See also

* [[belly]]
* [[belly grab]]
* [[curvy]]
* [[fat]]
* [[strongman waist]] 
* [[muffin top]]
* [[pinching]]
* [[weight conscious]]

title: undersized_clothes
body:
Opposite of [[oversized clothes]], this is for posts showing a situation wherein the clothes are obviously too small for the wearer. This can especially occur when two characters [[costume_switch|switch costumes]].

Undersized clothing are often caused by [[weight gain]], many inages depicting this include this tag.

title: lucifer_(umineko)
body:
Lucifer (ルシファー Rushifā?) is the eldest sister of The Seven Stakes of Purgatory, she represents the Fallen Angel Lucifer and the corresponding sin of Pride.

[spoiler]The human she is based on is [[Lunon (Umineko)|]].[/spoiler]

title: lunon_(umineko)
body: Lunon (瑠音, Runon) is one of the servants in [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]. [spoiler]From a meta perspective, she's the basis for [[Lucifer (Umineko)|]].[/spoiler]

title: mammon_(umineko)
body:
One of [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]'s Seven [[Stakes of Purgatory]], and representative of the deadly sin of greed. The fifth sister, and the one with the closest relationship with [[ushiromiya_ange|Ange]]. Set apart from her sisters by her long brown hair.

[spoiler]The human she is based on is [[Manon (Umineko)|]].[/spoiler]

Named after Mammon, a personification (or deification) of avarice found in the New Testament.

title: manon_(umineko)
body: Manon (眞音, Manon) is one of the servants in [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]. [spoiler]From a meta perspective, she's the basis for [[Mammon (Umineko)|]].[/spoiler]

title: leion_(umineko)
body: Leion (礼音, Reinon) is one of the servants in [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]. [spoiler]From a meta perspective, she's the basis for [[Belphegor (Umineko)|]].[/spoiler]

title: lenon_(umineko)
body: Lenon (恋音, Renon) is one of the servants in [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]. [spoiler]From a meta perspective, she's the basis for [[Leviathan (Umineko)|]].[/spoiler]

title: leviathan_(umineko)
body:
One of [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]'s Seven [[Stakes of Purgatory]], and representative of the deadly sin of envy. Second oldest (even if she doesn't often act it), with the only wholly unnatural hair color (green) of the Stake Sisters. Since all the sisters have red irises, perhaps the closest she can get to being the green-eyed monster is to be the green-haired monster.

[spoiler]The human she is based on is [[Lenon (Umineko)|]].[/spoiler]

Named after Leviathan, a Biblical demon/sea monster.

title: beelzebub_(umineko)
body:
One of [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]'s Seven [[Stakes of Purgatory]], and representative of the deadly sin of gluttony. The second youngest stake, she engages in her sin with gusto. Can be told apart from her sisters by her blond drill pigtails. 

[spoiler]The human she is based on is [[Belne (Umineko)|]].[/spoiler]

Named after the Biblical "Lord of the Flies", Beelzebub.

title: belne_(umineko)
body: Belne (鐘音, Berune) is one of the servants in [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]. [spoiler]From a meta perspective, she's the basis for [[Beelzebub (Umineko)|]].[/spoiler]

title: asne_(umineko)
body: Asne (明日音, Asune) is one of the servants in [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]. [spoiler]From a meta perspective, she's the basis for [[Asmodeus (Umineko)|]].[/spoiler]

title: belphegor_(umineko)
body:
One of [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]'s Seven [[Stakes of Purgatory]], and representative of the deadly sin of sloth. The fourth sister, younger than the three who represent the deadly sins of corrupted love ([[Lucifer (Umineko)|Lucifer]], [[leviathan_(umineko)|Leviathan]], and [[Satan (Umineko)|Satan]]) and older than the three who represent the deadly sins of excess love ([[Mammon (Umineko)|Mammon]], [[Beelzebub (Umineko)|Beelzebub]], and [[Asmodeus (Umineko)|Asmodeus]]). Can be told apart from her similar-looking sisters by her grayish-black hair, kept in a single ponytail.

[spoiler]The human she is based on is [[Leion (Umineko)|]].[/spoiler]

Named after Belphegor (an Assyrian god made Judeo-Christian demon), who is associated with misanthropy, innovation, and, of course, sloth.

title: wild_life_smp
body:
Sixth season of [[Traffic Life Series]], beginning on October 19th, 2024.

The primary gimmick of the season is wildcards: each session is given a unique twist on gameplay that lasts for only that session. Players all start with 6 lives, with players who have more than four lives represented by dark green.

Players can also steal lives from other players they kill, similar to the central mechanic of [[Lifesteal SMP]].

h4. External links

* "Life Series Wiki: Wild Life":https://the-life-series.fandom.com/wiki/Wild_Life

title: asmodeus_(umineko)
body:
One of [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]'s Seven [[Stakes of Purgatory]], and representative of the deadly sin of lust. The youngest, and perhaps more romantic than overtly lustful. A [[blonde hair|blonde]] with two straight [[twintails]]. 

[spoiler]The human she is based on is [[Asne (Umineko)|]].[/spoiler]

Named after Asmodeus, a legendary prince of Hell.

title: noah_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant from [[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]], debuted in the Babylon Singularity and designated as the Grand Rider. The depiction of the [[Noah (mythology)|Biblical figure of the same name]].

Right after being summoned, Noah was gravely injured by [[Queen Draco (fate)|]]. He barely managed to survive by entrusting his Saint Graph to [[Captain Nemo (fate)|]]. Before revealing his true identity, Noah pretends to be [[Nemo (Fate/Grand Order Arcade)|]], calling himself "Captain" and strongly resembling an older version of him.

As he is not part of the Servant, do not tag him with the Nemo umbrella tag.

title: third-party_edit
body:
An image that has been edited by someone other than the artist (a third party).

Third-party edits are generally against the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]] and should not be uploaded. This includes:

* [[nude filter]]s
* [[headshop]]s
* [[fake translation]]s
* [[third-party watermark]]s
* Fanmade meme or joke edits
* Removal of artist signatures or watermarks
* Anything else that substantially alters the content of the image

Minor edits that don't substantially alter the content of the image may be allowed under specific circumstances. This includes posts that have been [[stitched]], [[colorized]], cleaned, [[detexted]] or slightly [[cropped]].

h4. See also
* [[Second-party edit]] - a second party (such as the [[commission]]er or anyone with the artist's permission) is involved in editing the image.
* [[Photoshop (medium)]] - apply this tag when Adobe Photoshop is actually used by the artist to create an image
* [[help:upload rules]]

title: ogata_hyakunosuke
body:
A [[Golden Kamuy]] character. A former [[Imperial Japanese Army]] Superior Private and sniper. He uses an [[Arisaka]] type 30 [[rifle]].

h5. Appearance

Ogata is rather unemotional and cynical young man. He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair|black]] [[hair slicked back|slicked back hair]] in [[undercut]] style, usually with [[hair strand]] out. Has [[black eyes]], [[stubble]] and [[scar on cheek|scars on both cheeks]]. Usually wears [[military uniform]] ([[collared jacket|collared]] [[blue jacket]] and [[blue pants]] with [[gaiters]]) which has [[long sleeves]] and [[buttons]], often with [[white cape|white]] [[hooded cape]] over it. Since he's a sniper, Hyakunosuke is often depicted [[holding gun|holding]] and [[aiming]] a gun. Also, he has a habit of putting a hand in [[hand in own hair|his own hair]]

h4. See also
* "Wiki page":[https://goldenkamuy.fandom.com/wiki/Hyakunosuke_Ogata]

title: forget-me-not_(flower)
body:
[i][b]Myosotis[/i][/b], commonly called forget-me-not or scorpion grass, is a genus of [[flower]]ing plants in the family [i]Boraginaceae[/i]. The type species is [i]Myosotis scorpioides[/i].

Myosotis flowers grow in clusters (cymes). They are five-petaled with a bright, ring-like center that is yellow or white in color. The flowers are most often blue, but also come in shades of pink, purple, and white.

h4. Examples
* !asset #21844356: Photo reference: [i]Myosotis scorpioides[/i]
* !post #7497544
* !post #7560397

h4. Other Boraginaceae species
* [[Heliotrope (flower)|]]
* [[Nemophila (flower)|]]

h4. See also
* [[Tweedia]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Myosotis":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myosotis
* "Wikipedia: Myosotis scorpioides":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myosotis_scorpioides
* "Wikipedia: Boraginaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boraginaceae

title: lord_dearche
body:
One of the antagonists of [i][[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha A's Portable: The Battle of Aces]][/i]. Material-D, also known as King Ruler over Darkness and Lord Dearche is a "[[dark persona|dark copy]]" of [[Yagami Hayate]]. She wields [[Yersiniakreuz]], a copy of Hayate's [[Schwertkreuz]], and the [[Tome of the Purple Sky]], a copy of Hayate's [[Tome of the Night Sky]].

In [i][[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha INNOCENT]][/i], she is known as Dearche Kings Claudia and her resemblance to Hayate is merely coincidental.

title: levi_the_slasher
body:
One of the antagonists of [i][[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha A's Portable: The Battle of Aces]][/i]. Material-L, also known as Assailant of Thunderblade and Levi The Slasher is a "[[dark persona|dark copy]]" of [[Fate Testarossa]]. She wields [[Vulnificus]], a copy of Fate's [[Bardiche (nanoha)|]]. 

It is speculated that Levi loves eating [[sweets]], especially [[lollipop]]s. But some fanworks depict her as a heavy eater, much like [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] of [[Touhou]].

In [i][[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha INNOCENT]][/i], she is known as Levi Russel and her resemblance to Fate is merely coincidental.

title: honda_masazumi
body:
Honda Masazumi is a main character in [[Kyoukaisenjou no Horizon]]. The vice president of Musashi Ariadust Academy student council. She's very serious, skilled in debate, and aiming to become a politician. In the past she underwent gender reassignment surgery in order to succeed the family name, but certain circumstances forced her to stop the process part way. Her lack of breasts is a result of the surgery, but [[Aoi Toori]] treats her as a girl with a tiny chest.


h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Horizon in the Middle of Nowhere":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horizon_in_the_Middle_of_Nowhere

title: uzumaki_naruto
body:
The title character of the anime/manga [[Naruto]]. When Naruto was a newborn baby, a nine tailed fox attacked his home (Hidden Leaf Village). His father the Fourth Hokage sealed the beast within Naruto. Having a lonely childhood, he would grow up to become a powerful [[ninja]], harnessing the beast's power. His ultimate goal is to become the Hokage of the Leaf.

Voiced by [[Takeuchi Junko]] in Japan, and Maile Flanagan in the English dub.

h4. See also

* [[sexy no jutsu]]

title: survival_friends
body:
Survival friends is the derivative work of [[Kemono Friends]] and started by [[370mL]], a kind of so-called costume change creation.

It's based on rough style such as wrapping worn-out clothes around the waist and tying them.
This tag is attached to the picture depicting the situation in which "Friends" are dressed.
Even if the clothes of Friends are torn or dirty, they will be regenerated after a while, so it should be like this.

Currently, the design is set, but it is unknown whether the behaviour and personality are different from the original friends.
other_names: サーバイバルフレンズ

title: lost_property_004_(samidare)
body:
Lost Property 004 is a character from [[lost property control organization (samidare)|Lost Property Control Organization]], a series created by [[Samidare (hoshi)]]. One of the "lost properties" contained by the titular Organization, he is nicknamed "Mr. Wibblewobble" due to his elongated form. He enjoys collecting rare [[toy]]s, claims to know about the [[protagonist (lost property control organization)|]]'s lost memories, and offers items, information, and enhanced abilities in exchange for toys. However, the LPCO asks its members not to accept any deals from 004, implying that doing so may have negative consequences.

He wears a [[sweater vest]] over a [[white shirt]] and a [[necktie]], with his limbs made up of many [[tentacles]].

title: shiraishi_rei_(samidare)
body:
Shiraishi Rei is a character from [[Lost Property Control Organization (samidare)|]], a series created by [[Samidare (hoshi)]]. She works for the titular organization like the [[Protagonist (lost property control organization)|]] and serves as their partner on certain cases.

She has [[long hair|long]], [[white hair]], [[blue eyes]], and wears a [[school uniform]] with [[black gloves]].

title: rickshaw_student_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]], she's an unnamed student from Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy who pulls a [[rickshaw]]. Unusually for unnamed characters, she has a unique [[halo]] design.

She has [[yellow eyes]] and a [[black hair|black]] [[ponytail]]. She usually wears a [[red kimono]] with a [[black shirt]] underneath and [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]], and has a [[towel around neck|towel around her neck]]. She also wears a [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]]. She is often depicted as sweaty.

title: k.i.t.t
body:
[b]K.I.T.T.[/b] is the short name of a fictional sentient [[robot]] character from the American adventure and [[science fiction]] TV series [[Knight Rider]] released in the 80s. 

An acronym of [b]Knight Industries Two Thousand[/b], KITT is an artificially intelligent electronic computer module in the body of a highly advanced, very mobile, robotic automobile (portrayed by a modified 1982 [[Pontiac Firebird Trans Am]] sports [[car]] with a heavily customized interior). 

KITT was voiced by American actor "William Daniels":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Daniels in the original series.

h4. See also

* [[Michael Knight]]

title: girl_chasing_giants_(yun_ling)
body: Art series by [[Yun Ling]] that depicts their OC (a dark haired girl with no name) travelling real and fantasy worlds. She is usually depicted holding a bow with a quiver of arrows on her back. Clothing changes depending on the environment.

title: pocky
body:
A long, thin, [[chocolate]]-covered [[cookie]] popular in Japan similar to a biscotti. There are other Pocky flavors that are shipped throughout the world. In Europe it is available under the name [i]Mikado[/i].

Thanks to its immense popularity amongst the Japanese and elsewhere, it has been featured in a number of anime, such as [[Onegai Teacher|Please! Teacher]], [[Onegai Twins|Please! Twins]], X/1999, etc. Due to copyright issues, it is nearly always [[brand name imitation|mentioned under a different name]], usually a mangled pronunciation, misspelling, or homonym, such as Pooky, Pochy, Rocky, et. al. 

November 11 is [[Pocky Day]], because the shape of resembles the numeral 1.

Danbooru does not distinguish Pocky from Pepero (빼빼로), a Korean version of Pocky.

h4. See also

* [[holding Pocky]]
* [[Pocky Day]]
* [[Pocky in mouth]]
* [[Pocky kiss]]
* [[Pretz]]
* [[Strawberry Pocky]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* "Official Pocky site":[https://pocky.glico.com/global/]
* "Wikipedia: Pocky":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pocky
* "Wikipedia: Pepero":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pepero

title: saitou_hajime_(rurouni_kenshin)
body:
A [[Rurouni Kenshin]] character based off the real-life [[Shinsengumi]] samurai/policeman Saitou Hajime. 

Known for his [[Gatotsu stance]] and sword style, he is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[brown eyes]]; and is seen wearing a [[black shirt]], [[blue jacket]], [[black belt]], and [[blue pants]]. Voiced by [[Hino Satoshi]] in the 2023 anime remake.

title: kanna_asumi
body:
[[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] original character. (Not to be confused with seiyuu [[Asumi Kana]].)  A 12-year-old magical girl, she wished to bring misfortune to others around her and uses mental attack magic.

A magical girl created for a [[Futaba Channel]] hoax thread before the release of [i][[mahou shoujo madoka magica: hangyaku no monogatari|Rebellion]][/i], as a character who would supposedly appear in the movie.

She has [[silver hair]] in a [[bob cut]]. In her magical girl form, she wears a [[gothic lolita]] costume with a [[mini top hat]] and wields a [[flail]] as her weapon.

h4. See also

* Nicopedia article: http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4927351
* http://wiki.puella-magi.net/Translated_Official_Documents/Confirmed_Fakes#Asumi_Kanna

title: pumpkin_head_(elden_ring)
body: [b]Pumpkin Heads[/b] are minor bosses and rare enemies found in [[Elden Ring]]. They are named after the large bronze pumpkin-shaped helmet they wear, as they wear little else aside from their cape and rags. Some carry spikey flails, while others have a burning pole torch.

title: barefoot
body:
When a character's [[feet]] are completely bare, that is, not covered by [[shoes]], [[socks]], [[thighhighs]], or anything else. [[Barefoot]] should still be applied to [[nude]], [[bikini]], etc. characters, as just being nude doesn't necessarily imply that the feet are visible.

Use [[no shoes]] instead if the character is not wearing [[shoes]], but is wearing [[socks]], [[thighhighs]], or other legwear.

h4. Examples

* !post #4905014

h4. See also

* [[bare arms]]
* [[bare back]]
* [[bare legs]]

title: bare_legs
body:
When a character's legs are bare, not covered by [[pants]], [[dress]], [[long skirt]], [[thighhighs]], or [[pantyhose]].

Use this tag when the legs are not covered by clothes (including footwear) from the thighs until the middle of the shins.
Images should only have this tag if you can tell from the image that this is the case, meaning that all or almost all of this part of the leg must be in the picture.

Do not use when [[nude]] or [[bottomless]] applies.

h4. See also

* [[bare arms]]
* [[bare back]]
* [[bare shoulders]]
* [[barefoot]]

title: g-string
body:
A [[thong]]-like undergarment, only the back is a thin string of cloth. A g-string is generally more revealing than a thong. The two are best distinguished by their side straps: a thong will usually have wider side straps than a g-string, hence the presence of the word string. A g-string will also generally sit higher on the wearer's hips than a thong.

h4. See also

title: glass_door_refrigerator
body: A variety of [[refrigerator]]s featuring a glass see-through door.  Commonly these are commercial merchandiser refrigerators, refrigerators that carry chilled products for purchase that the customer opens themselves to select the item they're buying.  This tag may also include beverage coolers, a small mini-fridge-like device featuring a glass door used for chilling drinks.  Unlike a true refrigerator, beverage coolers don't reach temperatures cold enough to safely preserve food.

title: list_of_pokemon_media
body:

title: hoshino_(first_year)_(blue_archive)
body:
A non-playable alternate design of [[Hoshino (Blue Archive)|]]'s shown in flashbacks in the [[Blue Archive]] story.

Unlike her standard design, she has [[short hair]], and most often has an angry or serious expression. She normally wears a [[bulletproof vest]] and an [[armband]] over her Abydos school uniform, but may instead be wearing the [[abydos high school swimsuit]]. She may be depicted together with [[Yume (Blue Archive)|]].

Hoshino's first year design differs from her [[Hoshino (Armed) (Blue Archive)|Armed]] playable skin in that she did not have a ponytail, nor did her standard outfit feature a holster for her pistol worn atop the chest.

h4. Appearance

title: hong_xiuquan
body: A Chinese revolutionary and religious leader who led the [[Taiping Rebellion]] against the [[Qing dynasty]]. He established the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom and took the title of "Heavenly King" due to his self-proclaimed role as the little brother of [[Jesus|Jesus Christ]].

title: isekai_mokushiroku_mynoghra
body:
Light novel and manga series set in a world that resembles a fantasy turn-based strategy (TBS) game. [[ira takuto|The protagonist]] reincarnated in an unknown world as the commander of the evil civilization Mynoghra, the weakest civilization from Eternal Nations, his favorite TBS game. With Mynoghra's hero unit [[Atou (isekai Mokushiroku Mynoghra)|]] by his side, the two resolve to create a new nation in this world.

[spoiler]It's later revealed that Eternal Nation's rules aren't the only ones that apply to the world. Players and NPCs from many other different games have also been reincarnated and all of their systems work simultaneously, colliding with each other when they meet.[/spoiler]

title: hololive_grand_theft_auto
body:
A massive [[Hololive]] roleplaying event organized by [[Sakura Miko]] and [[Hoshimachi Suisei]], using [[Grand Theft Auto V]] + "FiveM":[https://fivem.net/] as its backdrop.  It ran for one week starting September 16, 2024, and involved almost everyone from all established Hololive branches.  Each member was given a "role", but aside from that emergent storytelling was allowed to unfold.  As a result, it has spawned many MANY memorable moments and setpieces, as shown in the art posted.

h4. Cast
h5. Ho-Los Santos Police Department
[b]Chief[/b]: [[Oozora Subaru]]
[b]Deputy Chief[/b]: [[Shishiro Botan]]
h6. Members
[[Sakura Miko]],  [[Mori Calliope]], [[Natsuiro Matsuri]], [[Tsunomaki Watame]], [[Kazama Iroha]], [[Koseki Bijou]], [[Nerissa Ravencroft]], [[Otonose Kanade]], [[Kureiji Ollie]], [[Vestia Zeta]], [[La+ Darknesss]], [[Shirogane Noel]]
h5. Ho-Los Santos Medical Department
[b]Director[/b]: [[Shirakami Fubuki]]
h6. Members
[[Ninomae Ina'nis]], [[Irys (Hololive)|IRyS]], [[Fuwawa Abyssgard|Fuwawa]] & [[Mococo Abyssgard]] (roleplaying as one person), [[Todoroki Hajime]], [[Ichijou Ririka]], [[Himemori Luna]], [[Airani Iofifteen]]
h5. Million Monster (Gang)
[b]Boss[/b]: [[Tokoyami Towa]]
[b]Underboss[/b]: [[Aki Rosenthal]]
h6. Members
[[Anya Melfissa]], [[Hakos Baelz]], [[Hakui Koyori]], [[Nakiri Ayame]], [[Nanashi Mumei]], [[Usada Pekora]], [[Akai Haato]]
h5. Others

title: houjuu_nue
body:
The "Unidentified Fantastic Flying Girl". Extra Stage boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Undefined Fantastic Object]] and Extra Stage midboss of [[Ten Desires]].

A fearsome youkai defeated by humans several times in the past, but whose true form has never been revealed due to her shapeshifting ability by way of her Seeds of Non-Identification. She goes out after living underground for centuries to cause mischief for [[Murasa Minamitsu]] and her crew who are out to save their master [[Hijiri Byakuren]]. Friend of [[Futatsuiwa Mamizou]] and [[Kijin Seija]].

h4. Appearance
* !asset #23810963

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[red eyes]], [[pointy ears]], and [[blue wings|blue]] [[asymmetrical wings|and]] [[red wings]]. Her outfit is a [[buttons|buttoned]] [[short dress|short]] [[black dress]] with [[center frills]] and [[short sleeves]] and a [[tomoe (symbol)]], a [[red bowtie]], [[black thighhighs]], a [[wristband]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[mary janes]] [[footwear bow|with]] a [[red bow]]. She is often seen with [[holding polearm|her]] [[trident]] and a [[snake]] on her arm.

h4. See also

* [[Nue Day]]
* pool #3165 ("Fancy winged Nue")

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Nue Houjuu":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Nue_Houjuu

title: pizza_box_computer
body:
A generally older style of desktop [[computer]] where the case is wide and flat, normally 1.5 to 4 inches or 4 to 10 centimeters in height.  It gets it name from resembling a pizza delivery box.  The common setup for this style of desktop computer is to have the [[monitor]] rest atop the case so that it may be at eye level.

title: atago_(azur_lane)
body:
Personification of Takao-class Heavy Cruiser from [[Azur Lane]]. 

In her default appearance she has [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]] with a pair of standing [[dog ears]] on top of her head, contrasting her sister [[Takao (azur lane)|]]'s folded down ears, and [[large breasts]]. She wears a white [[military uniform]] with a [[miniskirt]] and [[black thighhighs]]. Atago bears a passionate and caring personality, considering herself to be the "big sister" of the fleet, while expressing affection towards the Commander.

title: vinok
body:
A slavic [[head wreath]] worn by girls and unmarried young women, associated with the Ivana Kupala festival and [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] nationality.
Based on the flowers used, it carries certain meanings and supposed magical properties.

Its most distinguishing feature from the usual wreath is the addition of various untied ribbons of many colors that follow the wearer's hair.

title: kagerou_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
On the Fifth Anniversary update (April 23th 2018), [[Kagerou (Kancolle)|]] became the first of her class to obtain her second remodel/kai ni. Her rigging is now bulkier, with her [[torpedo_tubes|torpedo launchers]] now having reloads. One of her 12.7 twin gun mounts is now mounted on a [[handgun]] stock. Her hair ribbons are now [[white ribbon|white]] ([i]the most obvious change if she's not wearing her rig[/i]) and she wears [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]]. Her hair also grew somewhat [[long hair|longer than before]]. Stat-wise, she is a strong surface performer.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3098936

h4. [i]Kagerou[/i]-class destroyers with kai ni
h6. 18th Destroyer Division
* [b]Kagerou[/b]
* [[Shiranui Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Shiranui]]

title: shiranui_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
In her second remodel, [[Shiranui (kancolle)|]], like [[Kagerou Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]], discards her [[white gloves]] for [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves|black]] ones, the hair ornament changes and she gains a [[white ribbon|white]] [[hair ribbon]], her vest gets a little shorter and bike shorts a little longer, and she now wears [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[boots]] on her feet.

On her [[rigging]], she gains a mast, her [[torpedo tubes]] now have reloads, and an added bonus is that one of her 12.7 mm Type C twin mounts is mounted a la FN [[P90]] with a 25 mm AA mount on it.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3465331

h4. [i]Kagerou[/i]-class destroyers with kai ni
h6. 18th Destroyer Division
* [[Kagerou Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Kagerou]]
* [b]Shiranui[/b]

title: hayashio_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
Released on July 13, 2022, [[Hayashio (Kancolle)|]]'s kai ni form follows the standard [[Konishi (koconatu)|]]-design [i]Kagerou[/i]-class kai ni changes: a shorter and partially-buttoned [[black vest]] and the addition of weapons to her [[rigging]]: in her case, she gains an additional 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her right and attached to the rig, complete with torpedo reload lockers strapped to her waist. She also gains [[depth charge]]s on a [[thigh strap]] to her left, and additional 25 mm AA guns on her belt, while her [[handgun]] mounted 12.7 cm Type C changes to a rifle stock.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5505172

title: kuroshio_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kuroshio_(kancolle)|]] received her kai ni on the June 13, 2018 update. Uniform-wise, her footwear gets replaced with [[rudder footwear|rudder-heeled]] boots, she gains a thigh holster on her left leg, her hair becomes slightly longer and her hairclips change to resemble [[Oyashio (Kancolle)|]]'s. The most notable change is in her [[rigging|machinery]], with her weapons changing markedly, her [[torpedo tubes]] now having their dedicated reload locker, and her gaining a mast.

title: yukikaze_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel/kai ni of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Yukikaze (Kancolle)|]]. 

Her kai ni form, hypothetical as it is, reflects what would have happened to [[Tan Yang (kancolle)|]] had she escaped damage in a storm that led to her decommissioning and scrapping in 1970 and been successfully repatriated to Japan, and is therefore irreversible.

The second remodel has her wear a [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[black sailor collar]] (as compared to the original blue) with [[gold trim|dual gold stripes]], a gray [[neckerchief]], and a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt]]. She regains her original machinery and then some, with noticeable patina to her binoculars. She also wears additional hair ribbons decorated with anchor symbols and a cherry blossom on the right side of her hair, a reference to her Ten-Go comrade Yamato. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #4223150

h4. [i]Kagerou[/i]-class destroyers with kai ni
h6. 16th Destroyer Division
* [b]Yukikaze[/b]/[[Tan Yang (Kancolle)|]]
* [[Amatsukaze Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Amatsukaze]]

title: tokitsukaze_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Tokitsukaze[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Fujita Saki]].

She is portrayed with [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a [[side ahoge]] and [[short_hair_with_long_locks|long]] [[sidelocks]], and [[brown eyes]]. 

Her outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[tied shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], [[black hat|black]] [[mini hat]] patterned off her real-life funnel, [[black_pantyhose|black]] [[lowleg pantyhose]] with a [[side-seamed_legwear|side seam]], [[white_panties|white]] [[side-tie panties]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[high heels|heels]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a quad 61 cm [[torpedo tubes]] to her back and a 12.7 cm [[handgun]]. Tokitsukaze's official art deliberately gives her a somewhat dog-like appearance, mostly due to her hairstyle. 

h4. Skins

* !post #1759728: Default

h4. Personality
A trait shared with Yukikaze is the way she refers to the admiral, as "Shiree" ("しれえ～"). However, they differ in the way they talk. Yukikaze tends to yell while Tokitsukaze has a sing-songy voice.


h4. [i]Kagerou[/i]-class destroyers
h5. 16th Destroyer Division
* [[Hatsukaze (Kancolle)|]]
* [[Yukikaze (Kancolle)|]]
* [[Amatsukaze (Kancolle)|]]
* [b]Tokitsukaze[/b]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Tokitsukaze[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_destroyer_Tokitsukaze_(1939)]

title: jeb_bush
body:
[b]Jeb Bush[/b] is an American [[politician]]. Jeb Bush is the son of US President [[George H.W. Bush]] and brother of US President [[George W. Bush]].

His biggest claim to fame online comes from his 2016 presidential campaign, with his campaign logo "Jeb!" used as a nickname, being called "low energy" by his opponent [[Donald Trump]], his asking an audience to "Please clap" after being met with silence after speaking at an event going viral, and an [[jeb_wins_(meme)|image of him with his arms outstretched in front of a modified electoral map showing him winning the presidency flawlessly]] (despite in actuality having had a poor campaign and never becoming the candidate) all becoming symbols of ridicule.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Jeb Bush":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeb_Bush]

title: noce
body:
Character from the [[Rance (series)|]] series, introduced in [[Rance III]] as the main antagonist of the game.

Formerly a [[Dragon]], Noce is an exceptionally powerful Dark Lord affilitated with [[Hornet (Rance)|]] and her faction, though he has ulterior motives: His true goal is to resurrect the sealed Demon King [[Jill (Rance series)|]], manipulating fellow Dark Lords [[Aizel]] and [[Satella (Rance)|]], as well as the entire Helman Empire, to achieve this.

title: haniyasushin_keiki
body: The Sculptor God Crafted by Utter Isolation The stage six boss of [[Touhou]] 17: [[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]. She is a god that can bring her sculpted idols to life with faith. She is the creator of [[joutouguu_mayumi|Joutouguu Mayumi]] and her [[haniwa_(statue)|haniwa]] army. She has [[pink_eyes|pink eyes]] and wears a [[green headscarf]] atop her [[long_hair|long]], [[blue_hair|blue hair]]. She is adorned with a [[magatama_necklace|magatama necklace]]. Her [[green_apron|green apron]] hangs over her [[yellow_dress|yellow dress]] with a [[single_strap|single strap]] and is filled to the brim with an assortment of [[tools|crafting tools]], such as [[knife|knives]], [[paintbrush|brushes]], and [[pliers]]. She wears a pair of [[sandals]]. Summoned by the enslaved human spirits of the Primate Spirit Garden, she and her idols took control over the Primate Spirit Garden and posed a threat to the Animal Realm at large. Since her idols had no flesh, soul or desire, the beast spirits could not resist them. Hence, the beasts executed their plan of pretending to invade Hell in order to recruit the protagonists, kickstarting the plot of Wily Beast and Weakest Creature in the process. h4. See also * pool #18399 - That's not how you use a Haniwa! h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Keiki Haniyasushin":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Keiki_Haniyasushin

title: reta_(hyong311)
body:
[B]Reta[/b] is the name of a [[Dragon Ball]] original character created by the artist [[hyong311]]. He is the artist's personal version of the [[mirai senshi]] from [[Dragon Ball Xenoverse]]. He is often drawn with [[shallot (dragon ball)|Shallot]] from [[Dragon Ball Legends]] as either friends or lovers.

Reta is noted to be a [[saiyan]] with short [[brown hair]] and a [[monkey tail]]. He often wears a [[white jacket]] and [[black pants]].

title: tang_keke
body:
An idol from [[Love Live! Superstar!!]]. She moved from Shanghai to Japan to become a school idol. In Japanese, her name is pronounced "Tan Kuukuu".

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown_hair|brown]] or [[grey hair]] with [[parted bangs]]. She also has [[blue eyes]].

She has a big sister named [[Tang Mengmeng]].

Voiced by [[Liyuu]].

body: A medium-sized wild [[cat]] native to Africa, the Middle East, Central Asia, and arid areas of Pakistan and northwestern India. It is characterised by a robust build, long legs, a short face, long tufted ears, and long canine teeth.

title: black_doom
body:
The main antagonist in [[Shadow the Hedgehog]]'s self-titled [[shadow_the_hedgehog_(game)|game]]. He is the leader of the Black Arms, an [[alien]] race that inhabits the Black Comet. His face has three yellow eyes and two large [[horns]].
Black Doom aided [[Gerald Robotnik]] in the creation of Shadow by providing his DNA in exchange of receiving the seven [[chaos_emerald|Chaos Emeralds]].

Shadow can align with Black Doom's army by carrying out Dark missions and having one of his [[doom's_eye_(sonic)|eyes]] follow him, or support [[sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]] and his friends on their efforts against his invasion by completing Hero missions. Regardless, he acts as the game's final boss by assuming the two-headed form of [[Devil Doom]], and dueling [[Super Shadow]].
H4. See also
* [[sonic_x_shadow_generations|Shadow Generations]]
* "Sonic Wiki":https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Black_Doom
