h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #2369336, left one is Reina.[/tn]

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]], [[blue eyes]] that turn [[red eyes|red]] when vampiric, and [[medium breasts|modestly-sized]] or [[large breasts]]. Commonly portrayed wearing the [[Saikai Academy school uniform]].

title: bondage_mittens
body:
Pouch-like coverings that fasten securely around the wrists, holding the hands closed or palms flat. They are often used in [[BDSM]] play such as [[pony play]] or [[pet play]]. Unlike [[mittens]] for cold-weather use, bondage mittens are tubes or bags without a separate thumb and are typically made of [[leather]] or some other stiff material to prevent the wearer from grasping through the material of the mittens.

There are several specific styles that differ from the standard look:

* !post #7966668: Paw mittens 
* !post #7134904: Hoof mittens
* !post #3506677: Metal mittens

h4. See also
* [[armbinder]]
* [[taped hands]]

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_restraint#Types

title: pony_play
body:
A type of [[BDSM]] animal roleplay where the submissive participant dresses and plays the role of a pony and the dominant participant plays the role of handler/rider.
It can broken up into at least 3 subcategories:
* Cart Pony where the pony pulls a cart their handler rides
* Riding Pony where the pony carries the handler (either while on [[all fours]] or standing on two legs)
* Show Pony where the pony is shown off in various decorative attire by the handler.

h4. External link

* "Wikipedia - Animal roleplay: Pony Play":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Animal_roleplay#Pony_play]

body:

title: list_of_commonly_misused_tags
body:
h4. Mutually exclusive tags

The following cannot be used to describe the same object or situation

* [[ambiguous gender]] <-> [[androgynous]]
* [[bare pectorals]] <-> ([[topless male]], [[nude]], [[breastless clothes]] or [[underwear only]])
* [[bottomless]] <-> [[bare legs]] 
* [[greyscale]] <-> [[grey theme]]
* [[hands in opposite sleeves]] <-> [[sleeves past wrists]]
* [[hairband]] <-> [[headband]]
* [[jersey]] <-> [[track jacket]]
* [[looking at viewer]] <-> ([[facing viewer]] or [[closed eyes]] or [[blindfold]])
* [[nude]] <-> ([[bare shoulders]] or [[bare legs]] or [[bare arms]] or [[topless]] or [[bottomless]])
* [[official alternate costume]] <-> [[alternate costume]]
** [[official alternate hairstyle]] <-> [[alternate hairstyle]]
** [[official alternate hair length]] <-> [[alternate hair length]]
* ([[off-shoulder shirt]]/[[off-shoulder dress|dress]]/[[off-shoulder sweater|sweater]]) <-> ([[strapless]] [[strapless shirt|shirt]]/[[strapless dress|dress]] or [[tube top]]) <-> ([[sleeveless]] [[sleeveless shirt|shirt]]/[[sleeveless dress|dress]]/[[sleeveless sweater|sweater]])
* [[playboy bunny]] <-> ([[kittysuit]] or [[rabbit costume]])
* [[solo]] <-> ([[solo focus]] or [[multiple views]])
* [[striped bikini]] <-> [[white bikini]]
* [[topless]] <-> ([[nude]] or [[bare shoulders]] or [[bare arms]])
* [[x-ray]] <-> [[cross-section]]
* [[miko]] <-> [[nontraditional miko]]

h4. Specific mistagging

h5. Places

* [[changing room]]/[[dressing room]]/[[fitting room]]/[[locker room]]
** Not to be used interchangeably for just any rooms where a character would get dressed and/or undressed.
** [[Changing room]]s are the ones where people remove and store their clothes, usually when going to a [[pool]] or an [[onsen]].
** [[Dressing room]]s are the ones used by on-stage performers to change in and out of their costumes.
** [[Fitting room]]s are the tiny ones in clothing stores where individual customers can try on clothes before buying them.
** [[Locker room]]s are similar to changing rooms, but [[locker]]s must be visible.

h5. Objects

* [[animal ears]]
** Do not use for actual animals, which have these by default.
* [[costume switch]]
** Applicable only if there are multiple characters, to be sure there is a switch.
** Not applicable on single-character [[cosplay]] pictures. Add the appropriate cosplay tag instead.
** Not applicable on parent-child pairs of single-character [[cosplay]] posts.
** Not the same as a "costume change."
* [[crescent moon]]
** Do not tag for just [[crescent]] shaped objects, e.g. [[crescent hair ornament]]
* [[goat horns]]
** Commonly mistagged on [[sheep horns]]. Goat horns traditionally do not curl all the way around.
* [[naked towel]]
** Character must be wearing the towel, not just having it on their person
* [[no humans]]
** Does not apply to human-like characters such as [[humanoid robot]]s and [[furry|furries]].
* [[off-shoulder jacket]]/[[off-shoulder coat]]/[[off-shoulder cardigan]]
** Should be used when the jacket, coat, or cardigan is naturally designed with a low and wide-cut neckline.
** Do not use for open/partially open jackets/coats/cardigans that are simply worn hanging off the upper arms.
* [[red glasses]]
** See either [[red-framed eyewear]] or [[red-tinted eyewear]]
* [[see-through clothes]]/[[transparent]]
** See-through is for clothing, transparent is for other objects.
* [[short hair]]
** Not for [[medium hair|shoulder-length hair]]
* [[silhouette]]
** Not for mere [[shadow]]s behind objects; should be mostly featureless
* [[topless]]
** Only for female characters; use [[topless male]] for males
* [[vaginal]]
** If female character's genital is visible, tagging [[pussy]] is mandatory. 
* [[miko]]
** Only to be used if a character is wearing the actual traditional outfit of a miko: a [[hakama skirt]] (almost always entirely red) and white kosode or kimono. Otherwise, use [[nontraditional miko]] instead.

h5. Meta

* [[casual]]
** Not for characters that always appear in casual clothing
* [[contemporary]]
** Not for characters that always appear in contemporary settings
* [[humanization]]
** Refers to characters that were already humanoid to begin with being depicted as fully human; depictions of non-humanoids as humans belong under [[personification]]
* [[orc]] and [[ogre]]
** Orcs are commonly depicted with a green-skinned muscular or chubby body and sports a tusks, while ogres usually have a fat body and lacks any tusks.
* [[text focus]]
** Only when text is a major component of an image

h5. Actions

* [[squirting liquid]]
** Not for [[female ejaculation]]
* [[facing viewer]]
** Only for characters with [[closed eyes|closed]] or [[covered eyes]]
* [[floating]]
** When on water, use [[afloat]] instead
* [[partially submerged]]
** Not for just [[sitting]] in [[shallow water]]
* [[air guitar]]
** This is for pretending to play a guitar [i]without holding anything[/i]. Pretending to play guitar with anything but a guitar is using an [[unconventional guitar]].
* [[riding]]
** Only for characters riding an [[animal]] or a [[motor vehicle]], use [[girl on top]] or [[boy on top]], and [[cowgirl position]] for posts depicting a person having sex on top of another person.
* [[takeoff]]
** Only for characters or [[aircraft]]s leaving the ground. Use [[undressing]] for images depicting someone taking off their clothes.

h4. See also

* topic #14603 (Commonly misused tags)

title: fields_of_mistria
body:
Farming Sim & RPG developed by NPC Studio. Released in 2024 under Early Access.

Influenced by [[Bokujou Monogatari]], [[Rune Factory]], and [[Stardew Valley]] for the game; [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] for the art style.

The game's co-directors, Claire Belton and Andrew Druff, were the artists behind [[Pusheen the Cat]].

h4. External links

* "Steam: Fields of Mistria":https://store.steampowered.com/app/2142790/Fields_of_Mistria/
* "Twitter: Fields of Mistria":https://twitter.com/FieldsofMistria

title: personification
body:
When objects or non-humanoid characters ([[animal]]s, [[creature]]s, [[non-humanoid robot]]s etc.) are transformed into humans or humanoids.

Use [[humanization]] instead if a humanoid character ([[humanoid robot]]s, [[furry|furries]] etc.) is turned into a human.

[b]Do not use this tag on copyrights revolving around personifications[/b], unless the image explicitly shows them as a personification (such as [[creature and personification]] posts). This includes [[Kantai Collection]], [[Azur Lane]], [[Warship Girls R]], [[Umamusume]], [[Touken Ranbu]], [[Girls' Frontline]], [[Axis Powers Hetalia]], and others (see: topic #10067).

h4. See also

title: countryball
body:
A series of webcomics about the states of Earth drawn as their respective national flags in ball format, sometimes based on the histories and current politics of those states, sometimes just based on community in-jokes and absurdism. Also known as Polandball, as [[Polandball]] (the character) is the first countryball to be created and the start of the webcomics when it first appeared in late 2000s.

Characterized by [intentionally] badly drawn comics (often using MS Paint) and [intentionally done] bad spelling & grammar, as well as political incorrectness, national stereotypes, and historical facts. Polandball has become quite popular on certain parts of the Internet, entertaining (as well as educating) many on history, culture, and politics.

Alongside being used to tag the countryballs themselves, this tag is also used for posts which explicitly reference Countryball works or memes.

h4. See also

* [[meme]]
* [[Countryhumans]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polandball
* "Reddit: PolandballArt":https://www.reddit.com/r/Polandballart/
* "Reddit (and more): PolandballJapanese":https://www.reddit.com/r/PolandballJapanese/
* "Twitter (and more): PolandballTranslation":https://twitter.com/polandballtrans

title: countryhumans
body:
A specific tag used for [[personification]]s of countries.
Originated as an offshoot from [[Countryball]], with designs usually featuring ball heads, but they're drawn in a variety of ways. They usually feature their flag very prominently as either skin or hair.

Similar to [[Axis Powers Hetalia]], but with no set designs due to it being fan-created.

title: pickle_(grappler_baki)
body:
One of the antagonist/recurring character from [[Grappler Baki]] and the titular antagonist of the Pickle arc

Pickle is a primitive man whose his body was found perfectly preserved in a saline rock formation, hence his name. He was supposedly born during the Jurassic era and hunted [[dinosaur]]s for a living. He was brought back from suspended animation by American scientists. Pickle later attracted the interests of several powerful fighters who sought to test their strength, including [[Hanma Yujiro]] who viewed him as a potential "worthy" opponent.

While Pickle generally behaves in a stereotypical "primitive caveman" fashion, he is known to possess strength far greater than almost all of the cast, being able to match Yujiro and [[Biscuit Oliva]] in sheer brute force. Despite fighting with sheer brute strength with no martial arts background whatsoever, Pickle is able to defeat even the most skilled fighters though overwhelming endurance. He does, however, recognize strong fighters despite a language barrier and is shown to pay respect to any opponents he deems "worthy" on multiple occasions.

She has [[green eyes]] with [[+ +]] pupils and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[sidelocks]] & [[short twintails]]. She wears an [[orange headwear|orange]] [[deerstalker]], a [[brown cloak|brown]] [[plaid cloak]], [[white shirt]], [[black skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[high heel boots]].

title: hanma_baki
body:
The titular protagonist of [[Grappler Baki]].

The sole child between [[Hanma Yujiro]] and [[Akezawa Emi]], Baki was put through rigorous training by his father Yujiro since his youth in order to make him "The Strongest Creature on Earth". When Baki was 13, he was soundly defeated by Yujiro in a "graduation" fight that resulted in his mother's death. Baki has since sworn to surpass his monstrous father, both to earn his respect and to avenge his mother.

To that end, Baki started entering the underground fighting circuit with free-for-all rules, using these experiences to hone himself in hope of defeating Yujiro.

h4. See also
* [[Baki one-hand push-up (meme)|]]
* [[Triceratops fist]]

title: jack_hanma
body:
One of the recurring characters of [[Grappler Baki]]. Also known as "Jack Hammer" in the early romanization.

Jack Hanma is the first offspring of [[Hanma Yujiro]] born to a Canadian mother, Diana Neil, after Yujiro raped Diana during his time as a mercenary after he found out that Diana was sent as a spy by the United States to kill him. Since his youth, Jack swore to kill Yujiro in combat to get revenge for his mother for the trauma Yujiro has caused. To this end, Jack fanatically trains to become stronger while disregarding anything he deems "unnecessary" such as eating or bathing, to the point that his body became bone-tight skinny and that he could only move by his sheer will to live. Noticing his determination, an American scientist offered a "super steroid" that massively increases his muscle mass, which allowed him to endure the rigorous training he partook in.

While generally reserved and quiet outside of the fight, Jack is a ferocious fighter that will use any means necessary to obtain more strength and win, even if it means shortening his lifespan. He regularly takes bottles of steroids and stimuli as a part of his training (which he was able to endure the side effects of due to his "Hanma blood"), and has multiple body modification surgeries to increase his stature. He is best known within the series for inventing "Goudou", a "fighting style of the weak" consisting of [[biting]] the opponent on the critical parts of their body to defeat them.

title: chanchanko_(clothes)
body:
A type of traditional Japanese vest that is worn over other clothing.

It is often mixed up with other stuffed garments like the [[hanten_(clothes)|hanten]], dotera or tanzen, but is easily told apart becomes it has no sleeves.
It was mostly used as clothing for kids, but there is a custom for people who are celebrating reaching 60 years of age to wear a red chanchanko. This custom has become less popular in recent times.

Some well-known characters who wear chanchanko are:

* [[Kitarou]] from [[Gegege no Kitarou]]
* [[kitasan_black_(umamusume)|Kitasan Black]] from [[Umamusume]]
* [[Mito Mitsukuni]] from [[Mito Koumon]]

They also appear in a Japanese [[urban legend]] called the "Red chanchanko", a variant of "”Red Paper or Blue Paper”":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aka_Manto#The_legend].

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: my_little_pony:_friendship_is_magic
body:
A TV series part of the [[My Little Pony]] franchise that aired from 2010-2019 for a total of 10 seasons, mainly focusing on friendship and giving the ponies distinct personalities. The series was created by Lauren Faust.

It was designed to appeal to a broader audience by avoiding the usual trends of shows intended for children and girls, and occasionally has jokes that younger viewers would not understand. Because of this, the show has gained a large fanbase of teenagers and adults, and the crew of the show sometimes inserts jokes or references to these fans.

Originally only seasons 1 and 2 were dubbed in Japanese, but the dub picked back up (albeit with a new voice cast) starting in 2018 and is still ongoing, currently up to season 6.

For a list of characters, see [[List of My Little Pony characters]].

h4.See also

* [[cutie mark]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/My_Little_Pony:_Friendship_Is_Magic

title: scootaloo
body:
[[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]] character, one-third of the [[Cutie Mark Crusaders]]. Lives with her lesbian aunts Lofty and Holiday, as her parents are often busy and away - and idolizes [[Rainbow Dash]], who takes her under her wing. She is a tomboyish daredevil, similar to Dash.

A [[pegasus]] [[foal]] with orange fur, purple eyes, and a short magenta mane. She has abnormally small wings and cannot fly as a result of her disability.

title: sweetie_belle
body:
[[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]] character, younger sister of [[Rarity (my little pony)|]] and one-third of the [[Cutie Mark Crusaders]]. She is kind with a mischievous streak, and enjoys singing.

A [[unicorn]] [[foal]] with white fur, green eyes, and a two-tone purple and pink mane.

body:

title: plymouth_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] light cruiser HMS [i]Plymouth[/i], as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration.
Character design by [[Ohisashiburi]], voiced by Murakami Manatsu.

She represents the original plans for [i][[Edinburgh (Azur Lane)|]][/i] and [i][[Belfast (Azur Lane)|]][/i], armed with four quad 152mm guns and an expanded hull. Ultimately, development of the quad mount never finished due to gunnery and weight issues. Like other British/Royal Navy Light Cruisers, she is only equipped with Short Fuse AP Shells.

Her physical attributes are [[long hair|long]] light [[purple hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[white dress]], [[white footwear|white]] [[high heels]] with wings, and a [[red ribbon]] on her right arm.

Her [[rigging]] consists of a large floral white ring to her back, [[black wings]], a secondary set of [[white wings]], her four 152 mm quad mounts arranged two each per side, and two 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]] arranged one per side.

h4. Skins
* !post #5507401: Default, with rig
* !post #5533443: Default, without rig
* !post #5921442: [[plymouth (heart-throbbing refreshment) (azur lane)|Heart-Throbbing Refreshment]]

h4. External links
* "WOWS ship visual":[https://frm-wows-eu.wgcdn.co/wows_forum_eu/monthly_2020_12/Plymouth_wows_main.jpg.662983472bd18c809011fade65592531.jpg]

title: raiden_mei_(crimson_impulse)
body:
The initial costume and playable version of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[Raiden Mei]] when you start the game. 

It consists of a [[black leotard]] with [[pink bodysuit|pink]] [[armored leotard|armor pieces]] on her [[shoulder armor|shoulders]] and waist, [[black thighhighs]], [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]], and [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]]. She has one other costume with this outfit: her [[raiden_mei_(vast_ocean)|Vast Ocean]] original bikini.

other_names: スーパーマリオパーティジャンボリー

title: sudou_kayo
body:
Character from the [i][[Evillious Nendaiki]][/i] and the representative of Envy. Represented by [[Megurine Luka]].

The main character of [[enbizaka no shitateya (vocaloid)|Enbizaka no Shitateya]]. A Jakokuese tailor that killed an entire family of four in a fit of envy, mistaking the [[Miroku Kai|father]] for her [[Gakusha (evillious nendaiki)|late husband]].

Originally a [[black hair|black-haired]] woman, she acquires her current [[pink hair|pink-haired]] appearance after switching bodies with the sorceress [[ma (evillious nendaiki)|Ma]].

[spoiler]She was actually faking her madness, being lucid the whole time and deciding to murder the family as revenge for Kai starting the fires five years earlier that killed her [[Gakusha (evillious nendaiki)|husband]] and [[Sudou Ren|son]]. Having seen a prophetic vision after swapping bodies with Ma, she chose to obscure the reason for her murders to prevent the fall of Jakoku, as Kai was in actuality a member of a xenophobic cult.[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: julia_abelard
body:
The assumed identity of [[Irina Clockworker]] during the events of [[Nemurase hime kara no Okurimono (vocaloid)|]]. [spoiler]The body originally belonged to [[Germaine Avadonia]].[/spoiler]

Not to be confused with [[Mayrana Blossom]], who modeled herself in Julia's image out of extreme admiration.

For tagging purposes, Irina should only also be tagged if her main [[cat]] body is visible in the picture.

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: carlos_marlon
body:
A character from the [i][[Evillious Nendaiki]][/i] portrayed by [[kaito (vocaloid)|KAITO]]. His given song is [[drug of gold (vocaloid)|Drug of Gold]].

A prince from Marlon and the former fiance of [[Banica Conchita]]. He eventually became her chef using a false identity.

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: kyle_marlon
body:
Character from the Evillious Nendaiki and a side character of the Story of Evil series. Portrayed by [[Kaito (vocaloid)|KAITO]].

"[i]The King from the other side of sea[/i]", the son of the  Queen Dowager [[Prim Marlon]] and current sovereign of the Kingdom of Marlon. Although engaged with the princess [[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche]], he eventually fell in love with a [[Michaela (evillious nendaiki)|peasant]] which led to dissolve his arragement, sparking the invasion of Lucifenia against Elphegort.

After the death of his beloved Michaela, he allies with [[Germaine Avadonia]] and leads the revolution against the tyranical princess.

[spoiler]Actually he's just a mere puppet king, manipulated by his mother, who sought revenge against the Lucifenian Royal Family and take control of the whole region of Evillious. He's also the half-brother of [[ Ney Phutapie]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: gear_(evillious_nendaiki)
body:
Character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] and [spoilers]a reincarnation of [[Adam Moonlit]][/spoilers]. Represented by [[Kaito (vocaloid)|Kaito]], the awakened Vessel of Greed: the [[Marlon Spoon]], and caretaker of the [[clock tower]] in the [i]Evil's Theater[/i], which was used as life support of burned [[Clockworker's Doll]].

After inner mechanism of the clock tower deteriorated with the pass of the years, putting in danger the life of the Doll, he used his own heart to power it. [[houtei no nushi|This rejuvenated the doll]], leaving him as a husk of his former self, incapable of leave the tower.

His given song is [[heartbeat Clocktower (vocaloid)|Heartbeat Clocktower]] and he's a protagonist in [[chaban capriccio (vocaloid)|Chaban Capriccio]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: gammon_octo
body:
Character from the Evillious Nendaiki. Represented by [[Kamui Gakupo]].

Former founder of the Tasan party and brother of [[Nyoze Octo]]. He eventually left his political party for search the [[Venom Sword]] in order to get the rid of the curse of his bloodline, only to be captured by the inhabitants of the Theather built by [[Gallerian Marlon]] and put to work as choreman for them. He's a protagonist in the song [[Chaban Capriccio (Vocaloid)|Chaban Capriccio]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: ney_phutapie
body:
Character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] and a side character of the [i]Story of Evil[/i] series. Represented by [[Akita Neru]]. 

A gossipy  maid working for the [[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche|princess]] and the adopted daughter of [[Mariam Phutapie]]. [spoilers]Actually the illegitame daughter of  Marlon's queen which acts as spy for her mother and the step sister of Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche, [[Allen Avadonia]] and [[Kyle Marlon]] [/spoilers].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: seth_twiright
body:
Character and antagonist from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. Portrayed by [[Hiyama Kiyoteru]].

A brillant Leviant scientist and [[Adam Moonlit]]'s rival in the [i]Project MA[/i]. He took the head of the project after Adam's failure and was responsable of involve [[Meta Salmhofer]] into it. He also persuaded [[Irina Clockworker]] into kill the other candidates of the project and eventually saved her life, transplanting her soul into a mechanical cat after the [i]Levianta Catastrophe[/i].

[spoilers]Infected with HER, he sought to spread malice  and wreack havoc upon the world, which led him to create several of the [[Vessel of Sin|Vessels of Sin]]. After [i]Levianta Catastrophe[/i], he reincarnated himself as a demon and inhabited his own creation, the shapeshifter key, [[Grim the End]].[/spoilers]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: kiril_clockworker
body:
A character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. Portrayed by [[Hiyama Kiyoteru]].

A Leviant citizen, the fiance of [[Elluka Chirclatia]] and the older stepbrother of [[Irina Clockworker]]. A craftman and clockworker famous in the whole kingdom for his music boxes. After her sister and fiance were chosen as candidates in the 'MA' Project, a dispute broke up between both women [spoilers]which ended with Irina succumbing to her malicious nature and killing her sister-in-law.

In his despair he attempted to resurrect his fiance, with nefarious consequences. After the kingdom's destruction, the man was driven insane. Eventually he tasked himself intro create 12 music boxes which will tell and predict the history and fate of the world in the form of the 12 Clockwork Lullabies.[/spoilers]

He's the protagonist of [[Tsuisou no Orugooru (vocaloid)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: キリル=クロックワーカー

title: gumillia
body:
A character in [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. Represented by [[GUMI]].

A former forest spirit which was reincarnated as human by the sorceress [[Elluka Clockworker]], eventually becoming her apprentice and helping her in her quest to gather all [[Vessel of Sin|the Vessels of the Deadly Sins]].

After the events of the Merrigod Battle, [spoilers]she was blasted into the Hellish Yard along with  [[Seth Twiright]]. Incapable of leaving the place, she eventually assumed the role of the new [[Meikai no Nushi]].[/spoilers]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: lich_arklow
body:
A minor character  of the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] and a major one in [[E.A.T (mothy)|]]. A former forest spirit and the brother of [[Michaela (evillious nendaiki)|Michaela]].

After being expulsed from the forest along with his friend [[Eater Sabella]], they become undead Shinagamis and eventually were recruited as servants of the [[Banica Conchita|Master of the Graveyard]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: leonhart_avadonia
body:
Character from the Evillious Nendaiki. Portrayed by [[leon_(vocaloid)|LE♂N]]. His given song is [[eiyuu_no_yoroi_wa_tsuneni_akaku_(vocaloid)|Eiyuu no Yoroi wa Tsuneni Akaku]].

The Captain of the Royal Guard for the Kingdom of Lucifenia, one of the Three Heroes and the stepfather of [[Germaine Avadonia]] and [[Allen Avadonia]]. Eventually he was murdered for opposing the tyrannical reign of [[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: レオンハルト=アヴァドニア

title: bruno_zero
body:
Original character from the [i][[Evillious Nendaiki]][/i] series. The right hand of the corrupt judge, [[Gallerian Marlon]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: sudou_ren
body:
The young son of [[Sudou Kayo]], who less than a year after being born died in the Great Fire of Enbizaka. In her delusion caused from grief, Kayo would mistake those with his same [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]] for being her son, including [[Tsukimoto Bufuko]] and [[Kokutan-douji]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: clarith
body:
Character in [[Aku no Musume (series)|]] and [[Evillious Nendaiki]] as a whole. She is the focus of the song [[Shiro no Musume (vocaloid)|]] and is represented by [[Yowane Haku]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: fromage_de_tete
body:
Character in the [[E.A.T (mothy)|]] series. Focus of the song [[Atelier Horloge (synthesizer v)|Atelier Horloge]], and salesperson for the store of the same name. She is represented by [[Kasane Teto]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: フロマージュ・ド・テート

title: saruteito
body:
A character in [[Enbizaka no Shitateya (vocaloid)|]] represented by [[Kasane Teto]]. The current head of the Lang clan, following the tradition of all prior heads to style herself in the likeness of their ancestor, [[Chartette Langley]], from whom she takes her name. She accompanies [[Kokutan-douji]] on his journey through Jakoku to find his true mother.

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: chartette_langley
body:
A character from [[Aku no Musume (series)|]] portrayed by [[Kasane Teto]].

A maid working in the Lucifenian palace known for her tremendous strength. The daughter of a blacksmith and childhood friends with [[Germaine Avadonia]] and [[Allen Avadonia]], the former of which she would end up fighting alongside in the Lucifenian Revolution.

Years later, she would travel east to the island nation of Jakoku, where she would end up falling in love with a local and become the first head of the Lang clan.

[spoiler]She is responsible for re-smithing the [[Twin Blades of Levianta]] from their original form as a pair of swords into two pairs of [[scissors]], one western-style and one Japanese-style.[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: シャルテット=ラングレー

title: nemesis_sudou
body:
Character from the [i][[Evillious Nendaiki]][/i] and the representative of Wrath. Represented by [[GUMI]].

A gunwoman and assassin for PN and the illegitimate daughter of [[Gallerian Marlon]] and [[ma_(evillious_nendaiki)|MA]]. Eventually she becomes the Führer of Elphegort. She's the main character of [[nemesis_no_juukou_(vocaloid)|Nemesis no Juukou]] and [[saigo_no_revolver_(vocaloid)|Saigo no Revolver]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: meikai_no_nushi
body:
The Master of the Hellish Yard. A mysterious masked woman appearing before [[Gallerian Marlon]] at the end of [[Akutoku no Judgement (vocaloid)|]] and briefly joining the chorus of [[Chaban Capriccio (vocaloid)|]]. Determines who goes to heaven or hell, and believed to be in possession of [[Grim the End]] by [[Ma (evillious nendaiki)|]]. She is represented by [[GUMI]].

[spoiler]Her true identity is [[Gumillia]], who while alive was unable to leave the Hellish Yard after the events of the Battle of Merrigod Plateau.[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: gumina_glassred
body:
Gumina Glassred was an aristocrat of the Beelzenian Empire residing in Asmodean and one of [[Sateriasis Venomania]] 's many victims. A childhood friend of Cherubim and his brother, Gumina grew opposed to her betrothal to Sateriasis. Scorning Cherubim to avoid his brother murdering him, Gumina was later enchanted and abducted by the Duke, becoming the sixth member of his [[harem]].

Portrayed by [[GUMI]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: gakusha_(evillious_nendaiki)
body:
Minor character in [[Enbizaka no Shitateya (vocaloid)|]], represented by [[Kamui Gakupo]]. Singer of [[nozarashi no kubi onigashima nite (vocaloid)|Nozarashi no Kubi, Onigashima nite]].

An amnesiac monk wandering Jakoku attempting to recover his memories. Wears a fuka[[amigasa]] to hide the [[burn scar]]s on his face.

[spoiler]In actuality [[Sudou Kayo]]'s husband, Sudou Gakura. Due to both himself and Kayo's mother being disowned by the Octo clan, neither realized they were cousins until after they began dating. Despite this, they chose to marry and had a son, [[Sudou Ren]].

During Enbizaka's Great Fire, he used an ability inherited from his [[Sateriasis Venomania|ancestor]] to transform into a [[demon]]ic form and fly away from the fire to chase after [[Miroku Kai]], eventually collapsing from his injuries. Tragically, he only regained his memories after seeing Sudou Kayo's decapitated head on display, where he failed to recognize her due to her swapping bodies with [[Ma (evillious nendaiki)|]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: sateriasis_venomania
body:
The representative of Lust in the [i][[Evillious Nendaiki]][/i]. Portrayed by [[Kamui Gakupo]].

A duke reigning over Asmodean. The earliest appearing of the seven representatives in the timeline, Sateriasis appears to be a hedonistic man who bewitched women all over Asmodean with his powers. [spoiler]His true name is Cherubim, the deformed older son of the late Duke Venomania. After falling into despair, killing his whole family and almost killing himself, he was persuaded by [[Irina Clockworker]] into forging a contract with the Demon of Lust and reclaiming what was denied to him. He then stole his father's title, along with the name and identity of his younger brother.[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: サテリアジス=ヴェノマニア

title: adam_(master_of_the_heavenly_yard)
body:
Character featured in [[master of the heavenly yard (vocaloid)|]]. [[Eve (master of the heavenly yard)|]]'s twin brother. [spoiler]The reincarnation of [[Adam Moonlit]], born from the artificial black box womb in the [[Houtei no Nushi]]'s body. During the events of the story, he prematurely attempts a Re_birthday, causing himself, Eve, Houtei no Nushi, and [[Gammon Octo]] to be reformatted and sent to a parallel world, with the four of them reincarnating into their past selves of [[Adam Moonlit]], [[Eve Moonlit|Eve Zvezda]], [[Irina Clockworker|Maria Moonlit]], and [[Gammon Loop Octopus]].[/spoiler]

He is represented by an [[aged down]] [[KAITO (vocaloid)|]] with [[blonde hair]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: gallerian_marlon
body:
Character from the [i][[Evillious Nendaiki]][/i] and the representative of Greed. Represented by [[kaito (vocaloid)|KAITO]].

The main character of [[akutoku no judgement (vocaloid)|Akutoku no Judgement]], a corrupt judge who's after the [[Vessel of Sin|Vessels of Sin]]. The father of [[Michelle Marlon]] [spoilers]and [[Nemesis Sudou]][/spoilers].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: miroku_kai
body:
Minor character in [[Enbizaka no Shitateya (vocaloid)|]], represented by [[KAITO (vocaloid)|KAITO]]. 

He's the husband of  [[Miroku Mei]] and father of [[Miroku Miku|Miku]] and [[Miroku Rin|Rin]]. The object of [[Sudou Kayo]]'s delusional affection and her final victim.

[spoiler]Responsible behind the arson in which Kayo's [[Sudou Ren|child]] and [[Gakusha (evillious nendaiki)|husband]] died.[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: kaspar_blankenheim
body:
A minor character in [[Nemurase Hime kara no Okurimono (vocaloid)|]] represented by [[KAITO (vocaloid)|]]. The marquis of Toragay related to the Marlon royal family and [[Margarita Blankenheim]]'s husband, who married her for her wealth and not out of love. His poor spending habits and adulterous lifestyle lead the couple to have to sell most of their belongings before turning to working as part of the criminal organization Pere Noel under the codename Second Dealer.

He was Margarita's first victim in her series of murders, alongside his chosen mistress for the evening.

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: カスパル=ブランケンハイム

title: karchess_crim
body:
Character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. Portrayed by [[Kaito (vocaloid)|KAITO]].

Count of Marlon, the illegitimate lover of Queen Yufina and the man who started the investigation regarding the mysterious disappearances across the the region. Shortly after his lover [[Yufina Marlon]] went missing, he managed to track the case to [[Sateriasis Venomania]], the Duke of Asmodean.

[spoiler]After disguising himself as as woman, he managed to infiltrate into the Duke's mansion by [[crossdressing|disguising himself]] as [[Elluka Clockworker]] and stabbed him with a [[Grim the End|poisoned dagger]], killing him and breaking the spell over the kidnapped women.[/spoiler]

He would later marry Yufina and take her surname, becoming the ancestor of the Marlon Royal family and the reason for their [[blue hair]] (and their representation by [[KAITO (vocaloid)|]]).

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: adam_moonlit
body:
Character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. Portrayed by [[KAITO (vocaloid)|]]. One of the singers of [[moonlit bear (vocaloid)|]] and [[Ma Keikaku (vocaloid)|]].

A Levianta scientist and overseer of the 1st [i]'MA' Project[/i]. For fulfilling his ambitions of taking revenge for the sake of [[Maria Moonlit|his mother]], he manipulated the candidate [[Eve Moonlit|Eve Zveda]], not expecting to develop genuine feelings for her during the project's progress. After Eve's miscarriage and the Project's failure, the two eloped to Elphegort's Forest.

After Eve stole the baby twins [[Hansel (evillious nendaiki)|]] and [[Gretel (evillious nendaiki)|]] from [[Meta Salmhofer|another woman]] and killed her in a bout of insanity, he hid this crime and the two raised the kids as their own. Several years later the two were killed by their adoptive children, who took their mother's Original Sin and split in seven fragments which become the [[vessel of sin|vessels of sin]].

[spoiler]After his murder, he ended up inside [[Grim the End]] alongside [[Seth Twiright|its demon]], where he acted as its proxy in making demonic contracts. After the Battle of Merrigod Plateau, he was expelled from Grim the End and instead ended up inside the [[Marlon Spoon]], reincarnating as [[Gear (evillious nendaiki)|]] and later [[Adam (master of the heavenly yard)|]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: hakaba_no_aruji
body:
A [[Banica Conchita]] [[look-alike]] who appears in [[Heartbeat Clocktower (vocaloid)|]] as the awakened [[Glass of Conchita]] and the new [[Master of the Graveyard (vocaloid)|]]. She reappears as a minor character in [[Twiright Prank (vocaloid)|]] and a major one in [[Chaban Capriccio (vocaloid)|]].

[spoiler]Turns out to [i]actually[/i] be Banica Conchita as the new demon of gluttony. She is utilized by [[Abyss I.R.]] during [[Aku no Musume (series)|]] to try and disrupt the legitimacy of the Lucifenian royal family, with the instruction being to possess the heir [[Allen Avadonia|Alexiel Lucifen d'Autriche]]. However, because he offered her his snack, she instead decides to possess his twin sister [[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche|Riliane]]. The resulting chaos ends with Riliane losing her memories after being exorcised and Alexiel leaving the royal family, instead being taken in by the swordsman [[Leonhart Avadonia]] as [[Allen Avadonia]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: germaine_avadonia
body:
Character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] and a side character of the [i][[Aku no Musume (series)|]][/i] series. Portrayed by [[MEIKO (Vocaloid)|]].

"[i]The Red-armored Swordwoman[/i]", she's the adopted daughter of [[Leonhart Avadonia]] and foster sister of [[Allen Avadonia]], who eventually led the revolution against the tyrannical [[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche]] for the sake of avenging her father.

[spoiler]A Beelzenian noble whose parents were murdered by [[Leonhart Avadonia]] in conquest when she was a baby, with him adopting her in the aftermath. She is also the descendant of [[Banica Conchita]], giving her enhanced regeneration. This made her the target of [[Abyss I.R.]], who would eventually steal her body and use it under the alias [[Julia Abelard]].[/spoiler]

Singer of [[Eiyuu no Yoroi wa Tsuneni Akaku (vocaloid)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: ジェルメイヌ=アヴァドニア

title: maylis_beelzenia
body:
A character in [[Venomania Kou no Kyouki (vocaloid)|]] portrayed by [[MEIKO (vocaloid)|]]. A Beelzenian princess and a member of [[Sateriasis Venomania]]'s harem.

[spoiler]The child she has with Sateriasis would be adopted by the Beelzenian noble [[Tae Conchita]], becoming the ancestor of both [[Banica Conchita]] and [[Germaine Avadonia]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: meta_salmhofer
body:
Character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] and the protagonist of the [[Majo Salmhofer no Toubou (vocaloid)|]]. Portrayed by [[MEIKO (vocaloid)|]].

A ghoul child (a type of artificial human), member of the terrorist organization Apocalypse, known as the "The Witch of Merrigod". The lover of its leader, [[Pale Noel]].

After she was caught, [[Seth Twiright]] offered her the chance to be a candidate for the [i]'MA' Project[/i] in exchange to escape the death penalty, eventually giving birth to the twins [[Hansel (evillious nendaiki)|]] and [[Gretel (evillious nendaiki)|]]. Not wanting her children to suffer as she did, she took the twins and ran away to Elphegort's Forest, where she remained hidden with them until her fateful encounter with [[Eve Moonlit]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: メータ=ザルムホーファー

title: lukana_octo
body:
A tailor from Mystica, Asmodean in the Beelzenian Empire and the first of Duke [[Sateriasis Venomania]]'s many victims in [[Venomania Kou no Kyouki (vocaloid)|]]. Close friends with [[Lilien Turner]] and a descendant of the Loop Octopus clan, making her a target of [[I.R. (venomania-kou no kyouki)|]]

After the events of the song, she chooses to swap bodies with [[Elluka Clockworker]] in order to stop I.R.'s pursuit of her. Her child would be the descendants of the Octo clan in Jakoku, and by extension [[Gammon Octo]] and [[Nyoze Octo]].

She is portrayed by [[Megurine Luka]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: irregular_(chaban_capriccio)
body:
An [[Allen Avadonia]] [[look-alike]] first appearing in [[Chaban Capriccio (vocaloid)|]], who is implied to be the same individual as the main character of [[Re_birthday (vocaloid)|]]. His true identity has flip-flopped over time via word of god statements as to whether or not he is, in fact, [[Allen Avadonia]] or someone else.

As of 2020, [spoiler]with the new upload of Re_birthday combined with the [[master of the heavenly yard (vocaloid)|]] novelization, it seems to be that the character in Re_birthday is, in fact, Allen Avadonia, while the character featured in Chaban Capriccio (and mentioned in [[master of the court (vocaloid)|]]) is actually [[Adam (master of the heavenly yard)|]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: lemy_abelard
body: Character in the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] and a reincarnation of [[Hansel (Evillious Nendaiki)|Hansel]]. Represented by [[Kagamine Len]]. An orphan and adoptive son of [[Julia Abelard]], the Leader of Père Noël. Eventually he became an assassin for her criminal organization under the codename 5th. Pierrot. After snitch the betrayal of his fellow member, [[Elluka Clockworker|7th. Magician]], he was killed by her apprentice: [[Gumillia|8th. Sniper]]. h4. See Also * [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: allen_avadonia
body: One of the protagonists of the [i]Story of Evil[/i] series from the [i][[Evillious Nendaiki]][/i]. Represented by [[Kagamine Len]]. His given song is [[aku_no_meshitsukai_(vocaloid)|Aku no Meshitsukai]]. Originally born as Alexiel Lucifen d'Autriche, he's the adoptive son of [[Leonhart Avadonia]], the former prince of Lucifenia and the incognito twin brother of the tyranical princess [[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche]]. h4. See Also * [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: pollo_(evillious_nendaiki)
body:
Character in the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] and [spoilers]a reincarnation of [[Hansel (evillious nendaiki)|]][/spoilers]. Represented by [[Kagamine Len]].

Along with his twin sister [[Arte (evillious nendaiki)|]], they serve as loyal servants for the Duchess [[Banica Conchita]], even if that means to kill or cook anyone who antagonizes their master.

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: lilith_baldured
body:
Character appearing in the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] and [spoiler]a reincarnation of [[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche]][/spoilers]. Represented by [[Kagamine Rin]].

The daughter of Hanma Baldured, one of [[Ma (evillious nendaiki)|]]'s apprentices. Subjected to a failed experiment by MA, the girl was transformed into an ageless empty shell of her former self. Lacking a will on her own, she quickly was used as delivery man by the sorceress and eventually was incorporated into the criminal organization PN under the codename of [b]Postman[/b].

After the demise of [[Gallerian Marlon]] and the downfall of PN, she ended up in the [i]Evil's Theater[/i], where with the help of [[Arte (evillious nendaiki)|]], she recovered her own will and independence. Hiding this fact from Ma, the girl pretended to be the awakened [[four mirrors of lucifenia|Vessel of Pride]] and took the role of the theater's [b]Waiter[/b].

[spoiler]During the confrontation between [[Nemesis Sudou]] and MA, she betrayed her master, stabbing her in the back with the [[Venom Sword]], giving a chance to Nemesis for deliver the killing shot.[/spoiler]

She's one of the singers of [[Chaban Capriccio (vocaloid)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: miroku_rin
body:
Minor character in [[enbizaka no shitateya (vocaloid)|Enbizaka no Shitateya]], represented by [[Kagamine Rin]]. The youngest daughter of [[Miroku Kai]] and [[Miroku Mei|Mei]] and sister of [[Miroku Miku|Miku]]. Referred as the yellow [[kanzashi]]'s girl in the song, she was one of the [[Sudou Kayo]]'s murder victims.

[spoiler]She also is a a reincarnation of [[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: rin_chan_(evillious_nendaiki)
body:
Character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] and a side character during the events of [[Nemurase Hime kara no Okurimono (vocaloid)|]] and [[Gobanme no Pierrot (vocaloid)|]]. Represented by [[Kagamine Rin]]. 

A [[black hair|black-haired]] [[freckles|freckled]] orphan and childhood friend of [[Lemy Abelard]]. Having a beautiful singing voice, she aspired to become a famous singer. His manager, Ron Grapple, used his contacts with Pere Noel for change her face using the power of the [[Venom Sword]] into a [[blonde hair|visage]] [[blue eyes|akin]] to [[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche]], which she used to boost her career as a diva.

[spoilers]After discover her true identity and known she was exploited and abused by Ron Grapple, Lemy attempted to rescue her, which lead him to eventually murder the manager.[/spoilers]

She is the singer of [[Saribito-tachi no Waltz (vocaloid)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: riliane_lucifen_d'autriche
body:
One of the protagonists of the [i]Story of Evil[/i] series, and the representative of Pride in the [i][[Evillious Nendaiki]][/i]. Represented by [[Kagamine Rin]]. Her given song is [[aku no musume (vocaloid)|Aku no Musume]].

The tyrannical young princess of Lucifenia and the twin sister of [[Allen Avadonia]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: リリアンヌ=ルシフェン=ドートゥリシュ

title: arte_(evillious_nendaiki)
body:
Character in the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] and [spoilers]a reincarnation of [[Gretel (evillious nendaiki)|]][/spoilers]. Represented by [[Kagamine Rin]].

Along with her twin brother [[Pollo (evillious nendaiki)|]], they serve as loyal servants for the Duchess [[Banica Conchita]], even if that means to kill or cook anyone who antagonizes their master.

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: eve_(master_of_the_heavenly_yard)
body:
Character featured in [[master of the heavenly yard (vocaloid)|]]. [[Adam (master of the heavenly yard)|]]'s twin sister. [spoiler]The reincarnation of [[Eve Moonlit]], born from the artificial black box womb in the [[Houtei no Nushi]]'s body. During the events of the story, she prematurely attempts a Re_birthday, causing herself, Adam, Houtei no Nushi, and [[Gammon Octo]] to be reformatted and sent to a parallel world, with the four of them reincarnating into their past selves of [[Adam Moonlit]], [[Eve Moonlit|Eve Zvezda]], [[Irina Clockworker|Maria Moonlit]], and [[Gammon Loop Octopus]].[/spoiler]

She is represented by an [[aged down]] [[Hatsune Miku]] with [[blonde hair]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: houtei_no_nushi
body:
A character from the Evillious Nendaiki portrayed by [[Hatsune Miku]]. The Master of the Court and the awakened form of the [[Clockworker's Doll]]. She's the director of [i]Evil's Theater[/i] and believes herself to be [[Michelle Marlon]] [spoilers]but is actually a reincarnation of [[Maria Moonlit]]/[[Irina Clockworker]].[/spoilers]

After the death of her "father", [[Gallerian Marlon]], she inherited his title, his task  and his dream, seeking to fulfill his wish by recollecting the [[vessel of sin|Vessels of Sin]] while she jugdes any intruder who dares to enter the Theater seeking the judge's fortune.

She's the main character of the songs [[Hakoniwa no Shoujo (vocaloid)|]], [[master of the court (vocaloid)|]], and [[Aku no Inga wa Owaranai (vocaloid)|]] and is featured in [[Chaban Capriccio (vocaloid)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: michelle_marlon
body:
A side character from the [i][[Evillious Nendaiki]][/i]. Represented by [[Hatsune Miku]].

The daughter of the judge [[Gallerian Marlon]]. After her death, Gallerian treats the [[Clockworker's Doll]] as Michelle, being led by [[Ma (evillious nendaiki)|]] to believe her soul is inside it. [spoiler]The soul inside the doll is actually that of [[Irina Clockworker]]'s.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]After the end of the world, she contracts with [[Eve Moonlit]] and gains the appearance of [[Margarita Blankenheim]], losing her sense of identity in the process.[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: miroku_miku
body:
One of [[Sudou Kayo]]'s murder victims in [[Enbizaka no Shitateya (vocaloid)|]]. The oldest daughter of [[Miroku Kai]] and [[Miroku Mei]], and the older sister of [[Miroku Rin]]. She is represented by [[Hatsune Miku]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: margarita_blankenheim
body: Character from the [i][[Evillious Nendaiki]][/i] and the representative of the Sloth. The protagonist of [[Nemurase Hime kara no Okurimono (vocaloid)|]]. Portrayed by [[Hatsune Miku]]. A Levianta citizen trapped in an unhappy marriage with [[Kaspar Blankenheim]]. She's also member of the criminal organization Père Noël under the codename 3rd. Sleep Princess. [spoiler]One of [[Eve Moonlit]]'s personas while inside the [[Clockworker's Doll]], who stole the identity of the original Margarita after she died shortly after birth.[/spoiler] h4. See Also * [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: マルガリータ=ブランケンハイム

title: platonic_(akujiki_musume_conchita)
body:
A runaway noble and teenage thief frequently hired by [[AB-CIR]]. During the events of [[Akujiki Musume Conchita (vocaloid)|]], she is caught by [[Elluka Clockworker]] who makes her work for her instead. She is represented by an [[aged down]] [[Hatsune Miku]].

[spoiler]One of [[Eve Moonlit]]'s personas while inside the [[Clockworker's Doll]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: mikulia_calgaround
body:
Side character from the Evillious Nendaiki. Portrayed by [[Hatsune Miku]]. Her given song is [[plateau_no_hana_(vocaloid)|Plateau no Hana]].

Mikulia Calgaround, popularly regarded as the [i]Flower of the Plateau[/i], was the Countess of Calgaround in the Kingdom of Elphegort. After settling in the town as a florist, Mikulia grew in popularity and eventually married Earl Gilbert Calgaround, who presided over the region. [spoilers]To protect her public image, Mikulia murdered two visitors to the town that had been associated with her past, before eventually committing suicide.[/spoilers]

[spoilers]One of [[Eve Moonlit]]'s personas while inside the [[Clockworker's Doll]], who assumed the identity of [[Mikulia Greeonio]] after she died during childbirth.[/spoilers]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: ミクリア=カルガランド

title: mikulia_greeonio
body:
Side character from the Evillious Nendaiki. Portrayed by [[Hatsune Miku]].

She was a peasant from Abito, Asmodean in the Beelzenian Empire and one of Duke [[Sateriasis Venomania]]'s many victims. Under the presumption that he was her prince, Mikulia joined the Duke of her own volition as the second member of his [[harem]]. [spoiler]She was a vessel for the [[Eve Moonlit|demon of sloth]] until the creation of the [[Clockworker's Doll]].[/spoiler]

After she fled from mansion with the other victims, it's believed she worked as a prostitute for a time until she had [[Mikulia Calgaround|the chance to start over]] in a different town.

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: eve_moonlit
body:
Character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]], the embodiment of the Original Sin and the protagonist of [[moonlit bear (vocaloid)|]]. Portrayed by [[Hatsune Miku]].

A powerful Leviant witch and the first candidate in the [i]MA Project[/i]. After it ended with her twins being stillborn, she married [[Adam Moonlit]], the project's overseer, and they eloped to Elphegort's forest.

Delusional due her miscarriage during the project, she took the baby twins [[Hansel (evillious nendaiki)|]] and [[Gretel (evillious nendaiki)|]] from [[Meta Salmhofer]] and killed her. Several years later she was killed by her adoptive children, who took her Original Sin and split it into seven fragments, creating the [[vessel of sin|vessels of sin]].

[spoiler]After her murder, she became of the Demon of Sloth inhabiting the [[Clockworker's Doll]] and assumed the identity of several women during the story, including [[Mikulia Calgaround]], [[Platonic (akujiki musume conchita)|]], and [[Margarita Blankenheim]]. She is one of the component souls that fused together to create [[Ma (evillious nendaiki)|]] and later reincarnated into [[Eve (master of the heavenly yard)|]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: josephine_(aku_no_musume)
body:
[[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche]]'s favorite horse. The first named character in [[Aku no Musume (series)|]] and the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] as a whole. Created as a reference to the [[steamroller]]s commonly associated with [[Kagamine Rin]]. Consistently featured as a character in the musical adaptations of Aku no Musume.

Was the titular focus of a short story and manga both entitled [i]Aku no Uma[/i] (Horse of Evil), which expanded upon the character and revealed various details about them, including that they are [[intersex]] and [spoiler]that they are the reincarnated child of [[Held Yggdra]], originally being from the Second Period.[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: sennen_no_chikai_no_hate_ni_(vocaloid)
body:
[b]English[/b]: At the End of a Millennium Vow

A song by mothy featuring [[Hatsune Miku]] released as part of the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] [[Miku Symphony]] album release. It's sung from the perspective of [[Michaela (evillious nendaiki)|]], and serves as a spiritual successor to [[Sennen no Wiegenlied (vocaloid)|]].

title: white_phosphorus
body:
[b]White phosphorus[/b] is an allotrope of the chemical element phosphorus. The term is often used in reference to weapons that utilize white phosphorus, either as a component in [[smokescreen]]s or by directly weaponizing its toxicity and/or highly reactive nature.
h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: White phosphorus":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_phosphorus]
* "Wikipedia: White phosphorus munition":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_phosphorus_munition]

title: aku_no_inga_wa_owaranai_(vocaloid)
body:
[b]English[/b]: The Karma of Evil Will Not End

The 11th song in the Clockwork Lullaby series, sung by [[Hatsune Miku]] and [[KAITO (vocaloid)|]]. Set in the aftermath of [[master of the heavenly yard (vocaloid)|]], [spoiler]it tells the aftermath of the incomplete Re_birthday by [[Adam (master of the heavenly yard)|]] and [[Eve (master of the heavenly yard)|]], leading to them being reincarnated into their original selves in a false recreation of the Third Period along with [[Gammon Octo]] and [[Houtei no Nushi]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also

title: ano_hashi_ni_chikatte_(vocaloid)
body:

body:
[b]English[/b]: Ending Boy Hansel ([i]Pollo's Theme[/i])

An album-exclusive song by mothy featuring [[Kagamine Len]]. First released as a bonus download for purchasers of both the [i]Nanatsu no Tsumi to Batsu[/i] album and the [i]Aku no Taizai: [[Gobanme no Pierrot (vocaloid)|]][/i] novel. It tells the story of [[Hansel (evillious nendaiki)|]] and his reincarnations, along with the four possible endings for the Third Period.

title: spec_ops_the_line
body:
A 2012 third person shooter game set in Dubai after a powerful sandstorm.

A harsh deconstruction of the modern military shooter genre, it gained a cult following for packing a tremendous punch, and seriously addressing  themes such as [[ptsd|post-traumatic stress disorder]] and the morality of war.

h4. Characters
* [[Martin Walker]]

h4. External links
* Wikipedia entry: "Spec Ops: The Line":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spec_Ops:_The_Line]

It tells the tragic story of [[Kiril Clockworker]], his [[Elluka Chirclatia|fiancee]], and his [[Irina Clockworker|younger sister]]. An alternate version named [i]Clockworker -Tsuisou no Orugooru-[/i] was released featuring [[Hiyama Kiyoteru]]. Officially categorized by mothy as Zenmai Jikake no Komoriuta R (asset #23793501).

title: tooth_fairy_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]Tooth Fairy[/b] is a playable character in [[Reverse:1999]]. She works as a doctor of The Foundation, looking after young Arcanists, including [[vertin_(reverse:1999)|Vertin]] and [[sonetto_(reverse:1999)|Sonetto]]. By asking the patients to swallow a tooth fairy "or grounded up tooth fairy":[/posts/7210684], she can cure any of patient's toothache. Because of this, she was hated by toothfairies, and swore to make all of her teeth fall. Tooth Fairy (the person) prevent this by wearing braces. She is one of the main character in [b]A Nightmare in Green Lake[/b].

She is voiced by Alexandra Boyadjieff in English, and [[Uesaka Sumire]] in Japanese.

h4. Appearance
* !post #6823148: Default
* !post #6823155: Insight II: Sweet Dream
* !post #7450681: [[tooth_fairy_(ace_through_the_bagel)_(reverse:1999)|Ace Through the Bagel]]
* !post #8412518: Fairies Dancing at Dawn

title: chinese_text
body:
The image contains text in any form of Chinese. Usually, this means Mandarin Chinese.

There are two systems in writing Chinese, [[traditional chinese text|Traditional]] and [[simplified chinese text|Simplified]] (e.g. 馬 vs. 马). Mainland China, Singapore, and Malaysia use Simplified Chinese while Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan use Traditional Chinese. There is also an official system for romanizing Chinese known as [[pinyin text|Hanyu Pinyin]]. 

h4. See also

* [[bopomofo text]]
* [[cantonese text]]
* [[minnan text]]
* [[oracle bone script]]
* [[pinyin text]]
* [[sichuanese text]]
* [[seal script]]
* [[Tag group:Text]]
other_names: ข้อความภาษาจีน

title: abu_dabia
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] universe. He appears in [[Zeta Gundam]] and [[Gundam ZZ]]. 

[b]Abu Dabia[/b] is a [[mobile suit]] [[pilot]] of middle eastern background who is a member of the [[AEUG]] and part of the crew of both the [[Argama]] and the [[Nahel Argama]]. [spoilers]He survived both "The Gryps War" and "The First Neo Zeon War".[/spoilers]

title: hathaway_noa
body:
The son of [[Bright Noa]]. First seen as a child in [[Zeta Gundam]], he rises to prominence as a teenager in [[Char's Counterattack]] before taking center stage in [[gundam_hathaway's_flash|Hathaway's Flash]].

[spoiler]During the final space battle of The Second Neo Zeon War, Quess Paraya (a girl who a teen Hathaway Noa was in love with) gets accidentaly killed by [[Chan Agi]] (who pilots a damaged [[Re-GZ]]) while trying to protect Hathaway. Then Chan is herself killed by an enraged Hathaway in a [[Jegan]]. 

All these tragic events would haunt Hathaway for the rest of his life and serve as catalysts for his transformation into [[Mafti Nabiyu Erin]] years later. Under this alias he commands the eponymous terrorist organization and pilots the [[Xi Gundam]] against the now corrupt [[Earth Federation]].[/spoiler]

h4. See also
* [[Quess Paraya]]
* [[Cheimin Noa]]

title: sari
body:
A simple feminine garment made of a length of unstitched samite. It is worn around the waist just below the navel, tucked and pleated, wrapping around the body twice, the remaining length folded and draped over the shoulder.  It can also be raised to drape over the head for modesty and to conceal ones features.

title: zora
body:
A race of fish humanoids in the [i][[the legend of zelda|Legend of Zelda]][/i] franchise. They first appear in [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time]][/i].

They generally live in areas with large amounts of water. Usually a people with a prominent royal line, long lived, and technologically advanced.

In [i][[the legend of zelda: the wind waker|The Wind Waker]][/i], they are a distant relative of the [[Rito]]. May or may not be related to the [[Parella]] of [i][[the legend of zelda: skyward sword|Skyward Sword]][/i].

title: bridget_(guilty_gear)
body:
A character from the [[Guilty Gear]] fighting game series. First appearing in [[Guilty Gear XX]], born as one of two male twins in an [[united kingdom|English]] village where the birth of same-sex twins was considered bad luck, they were raised as a girl, prompting their [[otoko no ko]] appearance. 

Throughout [i]Guilty Gear XX[/i], they would reject the stigma of their upbringing and work towards proving their masculinity as a bounty hunter. Years later, as of [i][[Guilty Gear Strive]][/i], Bridget had since succeeded, dispelling the superstition of their village. In absence of that purpose, they experience unresolved doubts, ultimately determining to be true to herself, embracing her identity as a girl across the conclusions of her story.

Debuted in [i]XX[/i] with a sleeveless and shortened [[nun]] habit (for ease of movement, not because they are a nun), a giant handcuff as an accessory, and [[bike shorts]]. In [i]Strive[/i], the nun habit is replaced with a similar [[hooded jacket]], with the habit's [[mars symbol]], pointed to the upper-right, changed to an [[androgyne symbol]], pointed to the upper-left, matching the orientations of these elements as in the [[transgender symbol|⚧ symbol]]. In either case, they wield a [[yo-yo]] and their pet [[teddy bear]] [[Roger (Guilty Gear)|]] in battle.

[i]Current policy is to tag Bridget as male unless physical evidence in the image proves otherwise, including the presence of the [[transgender flag]]. Non-bodily evidence (e.g. [[transgender flag]]) is only relevant to {{Rating:General}} posts.[/i]

h4. External links

* "Arc System Works: Bridget":[https://www.guiltygear.com/ggst/en/character/bgt/]
* "Arc System Works: 11th volume of “Developer’s Backyard” (9/14 Release)":[https://www.guiltygear.com/ggst/en/news/post-1657/]
* Interview with Ishiwatari Daisuke and Katano Akira about Bridget: "Part 1":[https://newsdig.tbs.co.jp/articles/-/186739?display=1] "Part 2":[https://newsdig.tbs.co.jp/articles/-/186744?display=1]

title: asshimar
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]NRX-044 Asshimar[/b]

One of the first transformable mass-production [[mobile suit]]s developed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Earth Federation Titans]]. It had a tri-star shaped monoeye visor reminiscent of the [[Dom (mobile suit)|]], and its green and light orange paint scheme makes it resemble a [[pumpkin]] or a ham[[burger]] in MA mode.

After the fall of the Titans, the unit was studied and refined into the more modern [[Anksha]] used by the [[Earth Federation]].

title: renault_ft
body:
The Renault FT, also referred to as FT-17 and FT17, was a French light [[tank]] that was among the most revolutionary and influential tank designs in history. The FT was the first production tank to have its armament within a fully rotating turret. The Renault FT's configuration – crew compartment at the front, engine compartment at the back, and main armament in a revolving turret – became and remains the standard tank layout.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

title: washboard
body:
A washboard is a tool designed for hand washing clothing. The use of washboards have fallen out of use in the developed world, where [[washing_machine|washing machines]] have become common. For the developing world, washboards may still be a common sight. In some parts of the United States washboards are used as a musical instrument.

A washboard works by rubbing wet clothing against its corrugated or ridged side.  This helps to remove dirt from the clothing through abrasion.  If soap is used, the rubbing action helps to drive soap through the clothing and allows the soap to carry dirt away.

title: ole_tower
body:
[b]Over Legend Endless Tower[/b] (Abbreviated as [i]Ole Tower[/i]) is a Japanese webgame developed by SE Mobile and Online Co.Ltd.

The main purpose of the game is to build an "endless" tower using different "tool girls" (Kenhime) at your disposal. The game also includes a combat system in a phase-by-phase and turn-based fashion, similar to many other games on DMM including [[Kantai Collection]].

The game has gained popularity with a moderate amount of [[Kantai Collection]] fans due to the obvious similarity.

title: logan_(movie)
body: Logan is a 2017 American superhero film starring [[Hugh Jackman]] as the titular character. It is the tenth film in the [[X-Men film series]] and the third and final installment in the Wolverine trilogy, following [[X-Men Origins: Wolverine]] (2009) and [[The Wolverine]] (2013). The film, which takes inspiration from the "Old Man Logan" comics storyline by Mark Millar and Steve McNiven, follows an aged [[Wolverine (x-men)|]] and an extremely ill [[Charles Xavier]] who must defend a young mutant named [[x-23|Laura]] from the Reavers led by [[Donald Pierce]] and Zander Rice.

title: pokemon_horizons
body:
The eighth series of the [[pokemon (anime)|Pokémon anime]]. It succeeds [i][[pokemon journeys|Pokémon Journeys: The Series]][/i]. It premiered on April 14, 2023 in Japan with a one-hour special, and on March 7, 2024 in the United States. 

The series features dual protagonists [[Liko (pokemon)|]] and [[Roy (pokemon)|]], who join together with a group of adventurers known as the Rising Volt Tacklers and set out to travel the Pokémon world with them, visiting all the regions introduced in the core series from Kanto to Paldea. Liko also finds herself targeted by the mysterious Explorers organization, which is after her equally mysterious pendant.

title: alternative_girls
body:
A mobile gacha game published by CyberAgent. The player takes the role of the Captain and is tasked with training and advising the Alterna, schoolgirls who protect humans from hostile Night Beasts.

One of the most notable features was allowing the player to experience certain scenes with the Alterna in VR, including character and event stories, karaoke, and lying in bed with them.

title: metal_slug

title: chibull_seijin
body: An [[alien]] from [[Ultraseven (series)|]].

title: ocean_sunfish
body:
Common name for the [i]Molidae[/i] family of fishes, also commonly known as Ocean Sunfishes.

Their body shape comes to an end just behind the dorsal and anal fins, giving them a "half-fish" appearance. 

The most Famous members of this family is the Ocean Sunfish ([i]Mola Mola[/i]) and the Southern Sunfish ([i]Mola Alexandrini[/i]).

This tag will also apply for freshwater sunfish in the family, Centrarchidae.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Ocean Sunfish":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mola_(fish)]
* "Wikipedia -  Freshwater Sunfish":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centrarchidae]

title: hotchkiss_h39
body:
The H35 was a French light [[tank]] developed prior to [[World War II]]. Despite having been designed from 1933 as a rather slow but well-armoured light infantry support tank, the type was initially rejected by the French Infantry because it proved difficult to steer while driving cross-country, and was instead adopted in 1936 by the French Cavalry.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* "External Link - Wikipedia: H35":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hotchkiss_H35

body:

She is based off of [[Andre Grandier]] from the series [[Versailles no Bara]].

title: somua_s35
body:
The S35 was a French Cavalry [[tank]] of [[World War II]]. Built from 1936 until 1940 to equip the armoured divisions of the Cavalry, it was for its time a relatively agile medium-weight tank, superior in armour and armament to its French and foreign competitors, such as the contemporary versions of the German [[Panzer III]]. It was constructed from well-sloped, mainly cast, armour sections, that however made it expensive to produce and time-consuming to maintain.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* "External Link - Wikipedia: S35":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SOMUA_S35

title: kawashima_momo
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Gunner and loader of Team [[Turtle]] in a [[Panzer 38(t)]] ([tn]later upgraded to a [[Jagdpanzer 38(t)]][/tn]) on the "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team. Also the Public Relations Manager of the student council. Is made the overall commander for [i]Das Finale[/i].

Her name means [[peach]], and is fruit-based like the other members of the student council.

Voiced by [[Ueda Kana]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h6. Original Anime

Runs public relations for the Ooarai Girls Academy student council. Supports the shenanigans of the president. Is a senior.

[tn]Source: post #1291295[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Affiliated with the Ooarai Girls Academy tankery team. Is Team Turtle's loader, gunner, and radio operator. Despite her constant condescending attitude, she's actually weak in a pinch and will panic right away. Faithful to the President, during the crisis of the second school closing, she was viewed as conducting herself in an admirable way as a substitute for the President.  Although in charge of the gunnery, her aim is shockingly terrible.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]

title: marder_iii
body:
The [b]Marder III[/b] is the name for a type of [[World War II]] German [[self-propelled artillery]] used as [[tank]] destroyers and built on the chassis of a [[Panzer 38(t)]] tank. 

The German word [i]Marder[/i] means "marten" in English. They were in production from 1942 to 1944 and served with the [[Wehrmacht]] on all fronts until the end of the war.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Marder III":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marder_III

title: koyama_yuzu
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Driver of Team [[Turtle]] in a [[Panzer 38(t)]] ([tn]later upgraded to a [[Jagdpanzer 38(t)]][/tn]) on the "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.. Also Vice President of the student council.

Her name is based on the citrus fruit [[yuzu (fruit)|yuzu]], and is fruit-based like the other members of the student council.

Voiced by [[Takahashi Mikako]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h6. Original Anime

The gentle Vice President of the Student Council. It feels like she's being manipulated quite a bit by the President and Kawashima. Everyone admires her big boobs. Is a senior.

[tn]Source: post #1283992[/tn]

Affiliated with the Ooarai Girls Academy tankery team. Team Turtle's driver. Former Student Council Vice President. A competent right-hand, she fills in on the management of the Student Council for Anzu who usually does nothing. title: panzer_38(t)
body:
Originally a Czech tank of pre-World War II design. After Czechoslovakia was taken over by Germany, it was adopted by the German Army, seeing service in the invasions of Poland, France and Russia. Production ended in 1942, when its armament was deemed inadequate. In all, over 1400 were manufactured. The chassis continued to be produced for [[Marder III]] (1942-1944) and [[jagdpanzer_38(t)|Hetzer]] (1944-1945) tank destroyers, turretless assault guns, anti-tank guns and anti-aircraft guns.

The (t) stands for [i]tschechisch[/i], the German word for Czech; the Czechoslovak military designation was LT vz. 38. Manufacturer's designations included TNH series, TNHPS, LTP and LTH). The special vehicle designation for the tank in Germany was Sd.Kfz. 140.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Panzer 38(t)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzer_38%28t%29
* GuP Website "Panzerkampfwagen 38(t)":http://girls-und-panzer.jp/mecha_38t.html

body:

While this may be done for a variety of reasons, the most common reasons are to cover up oneself, use as an improvised blanket to stay warm, or use as an improvised [[cloak]] or [[cape]].

title: waifu2x
body:
[i]Single-Image Super-Resolution for Anime-Style Art using Deep Convolutional Neural Networks.[/i]

An [[upscaled|upscaling]] and [[noise reduction]] algorithm specifically designed to work on 2D anime-style art.

Like any other form of [[third-party edit|third-party]] [[upscaled|upscaling]], third-party Waifu2X upscales are only accepted if the original version is not available, and should be flagged/deleted if the original picture is uploaded.

If you want to upload a picture that has gone through Waifu2X, follow [[help:image source]] for instructions on how to try and find the original picture first, and only upload the upscaled version if reverse searching fails.

h4. See also

* [[image sample]]
* [[resized]]

h4. External links

* Online demo application: https://www.waifu2x.net/

title: megatron
body:
[b]Megatron[/b] is one of the most well-known villains of the [[Transformers]] franchise. He is the powerful and merciless leader of the antagonist faction, the evil [[Decepticon]]s.

His original alternate mode is a grey and silver [[Walther P38]] [[handgun]] with several attachments. His vehicular mode varies in each depiction, but he usually transforms into a [[military]] vehicle. Notably as [[M1 Abrams]] main battle tank in the [[transformers (live action)|live action movie]].

Megatron's first G1 design was created by designer Ohno Kouhjin for the [i]Diaclone[/i] japanese [[transformation]] [[robot]] [[toy]] series in the early 80s.

[quote]Motto: [i]"Peace through tyranny...!!!"[/i][/quote]

h1. Alternate Versions
* Galvatron - [spoilers]the upgraded form [[Unicron]] gives to Megatron in the G1 movie, and the name used for his upgraded form in several later series as well. As[/spoilers] Galvatron is sometimes depicted as a completely separate character, at times existing alongside Megatron, images of Galvatron alone should not be tagged as [[Megatron]].
* [[Optimal Megatron]]  - Megatron's upgraded form in [[Beast Machines]].
* [[Gigatron]] - The Decepticon leader in [[Transformers Car Robots|Car Robots]], who was renamed to Megatron in the English dub.
* [[Megatron (IDW)]] - the [[the transformers (idw)|IDW Comics]] depiction of Megatron, most notable for his sincere attempts at atonement and defection to the [[Autobot|Autobots]].
* [[Megatron (Prime)]] - the depiction of Megatron in [[Transformers Prime]], with a design inspired by his appearance in the [[transformers (live action)|live action films]].
* [[Megatron (Shattered Glass)]] - the depiction of Megatron in the [[transformers shattered glass|Shattered Glass]] AU, in which he is the noble leader of the benevolent [[decepticon|Decepticons]].
* [[Megatron (Kotobukiya Bishoujo)]] -  a [[humanization|humanized]] [[genderswap (mtf)|female]] version of Megatron from the [[Kotobukiya Bishoujo]] figure line.

h4. See also

* [spoilers][[Galvatron]][/spoilers]
* [[Megatron (Beast Wars)]] - The [[Predacon]] leader in [[Beast Wars]], transforms into a [[tyrannosaurus rex]].

title: erina_batch
body:
A character from [[GALZOO Island]], who serves as [[Leopold Maala]]'s arch-rival and adoptive sister. 

Throughout the game, she will attempt to capture and tame any Gal Monsters not captured by Leopold, and will succeed in doing so if Leopold takes too long. To illustrate this, she is always guaranteed to capture and tame a [[Tenten (Alicesoft)|]], who becomes her accomplace.

Additionally, Erina also makes a cameo in [[Sengoku Rance]], serving as a bonus unit after completing the game once.

The third game in the [[Rance (series)|]] series, released for the [[PC-98 (computer)|]] in 1991. It is notable for introducing many settings and concepts that would become staples of the Rance universe, including Dark Lords, the Helman Empire, and expanding on the Kingdom of Leazas.

It received a remake for [[Microsoft Windows]] platforms, titled [[Rance 03]], in 2015.

title: neopet_(creature)
body:
The titular [[creature]]s that inhabit [[Neopets]]. They come in many colors, that can be applied to a pet using a paintbrush or other specific methods such as a morphing potion or the lab ray.

Neopets range in degree of sentience - most named characters are [[furry|anthropomorphic]], while the player's Neopets are treated more similarly to actual pets.

h4. Species

* [[Acara]]
* [[Aisha (neopets)|]]
* [[Blumaroo]]
* [[Buzz (neopets)|]]
* [[Chia (neopets)|]]
* [[Chomby]]
* [[Cybunny]]
* [[Draik]]
* [[Eyrie]]
* [[Gelert]]
* [[Ixi (neopets)|]]
* [[Kacheek]]
* [[Kougra]]
* [[Kyrii]]
* [[Lenny (neopets)|]]

h4. Colors

h4. See also

* [[petpet]]
